name: AA
def: AA - Agency Anywhere - A browser-based client application that provides an interface to Agency-related IT systems.

name: AAA
def: AAA - American Academy of Actuaries - The public policy, communications, and professionalism organization for all actuaries in the United States.

name: AAE
def: AAE - Agency Accounting Experience - Allied system for accounting of Des Moines Platform accounting data not on a direct feed to Finance.

name: AAE
def: AAE - All Associate Experience - Used by planners of the All Associate Experience held in Nationwide Arena.

name: AAM
def: AAM - Account Attribute Matrix - Identifies the required dimensionality and chart fields for combinations of Account, Account Book and Legal Entity. When FIL interface files are received, they process against this matrix to ensure data validity. Manual Journal Entry (MJE) users are encouraged to run AAM queries to identify invalid combinations.

name: AAMGA
def: AAMGA - American Association of Managing General Agents - The international trade association for the wholesale insurance community.

name: AAP
def: AAP - Associate Assistance Program - Nationwide's AAP is administered by a third party to provide a large network of resources, licensed providers and facilities to ensure you get personalized, proactive solutions for your specific needs.

name: AARD
def: AARD - Actuarial Analysis Report Development

name: AAT
def: AAT - Access Authorization Tool - NI Systems software used to set user access rights (e.g., rights of primary agent vs. office admin).

name: ABA
def: ABA - American Bankers Association

name: ABC
def: ABC - Activity Based Costing - One approach towards cost accounting, also a application acronym for one of our retired accounting systems.

name: ABEND
def: ABEND - ABnormal ENDing - Typically associated with the abnormal ending of a mainframe batch or on-line process

name: ABS
def: ABS - Agency Billing System - An application that manages the charging of Nationwide agents for NSC products underneath the BPS suite of applications.

name: ABS
def: ABS - Asset-backed security

name: ABU
def: ABU - Auditable Business Unit - System capable of being defined and evaluated as a unit. Examples include Commercial Mortgage Loans, Nationwide Bank Consumer Lending, P&C CAT Risk Management, and IT Strategy and Governance.

name: AC
def: AC - Agent Center - The primary front-end policy management interface suite for insurance agencies selling Des Moines Platform policies. Now usually prefixed by product system name/acronym (1MSA, 1RV, CIQ, Dwelling, Homeowners, Personal Lines Auto).

name: AC
def: AC - Artisan Contractors - Includes many occupations that involve skilled work with tools at the premises of the customer.

name: ACAS
def: ACAS - Associate of The Casualty Actuarial Society - A member of the Casualty Actuarial Society. This is the first level of membership.

name: ACB
def: ACB - Agency Capital Builders - An entry-level position for the person who wants to start working for themselves, but needs the resources, capital and support. In as little as 18-24 months, agents can be on their way to a successful career.

name: ACC
def: ACC - Association of Corporate Counsel - The Association of Corporate Counsel (ACC) is the world's largest organization serving the professional and business interests of attorneys who practice in the legal departments of corporations, associations and other private-sector organizations around the globe.

name: ACCTG
def: ACCTG - Accounting Systems - A general term for the set of accounting systems including PeopleSoft Financials.

name: ACD
def: ACD - Annuity Commencement Date - The date on which annuity payments are scheduled to begin. This date may be changed by the contract owner with Nationwide's consent.

name: ACE
def: ACE - Actuarial Central Estimate - The actuaries' best estimate of reserves, typically based on detailed claim reviews (see Policy Limits Analysis or PLA), curve fitting, and market share techniques. Considerable judgment is involved in selecting estimates.

name: ACE
def: ACE - Achieving Claims Excellence - Legacy Claims adjustment reporting closely tied to Claims Adjustment Support System (CLASS). A claim handling process where Claim Managers review files handled by their Claim Associates to identify areas for improvement opportunity.

name: ACG
def: ACG - Advanced Consulting Group - A diverse group of experts who provide comprehensive consultation on advanced concepts that involve accumulation and distribution strategies, business planning, estate planning, farm succession planning, nonqualified executive benefit planning, and qualified retirement planning.

name: ACH
def: ACH - Automated Clearing House - A computerized facility used by member depository institutions to electronically combine, sort and distribute inter-bank credits and debits.

name: ACL
def: ACL - Access Control List - Typically associated with the Lotus Notes security model where certain groups are assigned user rights as listed within the Access Control List.

name: ACLI
def: ACLI - American Council of Life Insurers

name: ACP
def: ACP - Accelerated Commercial Product - Initial strategic initiative designed to increase commercial new business production for the exclusive agency channel by allowing use of Des Moines platform Commercial products. Its success led to transfer of all products to a single system.

name: ACP
def: ACP - Agent Claims Partnership - Claims interface for agencies that allows claims and payment information to be entered by agents and forwarded to Claims Processing System (CPS). Handles auto/fire claims less than or equal to $2,500.

name: ACROD
def: ACORD - Association for Cooperative Operations Research and Development - A global, nonprofit organization serving the insurance and related industries. It facilitates the development of open consensus data standards and forms, and works with its members and partner organizations to drive implementation of those standards.

name: ACT
def: ACT - Avaya Centralized Telephony - Avaya Centralized Telephony (ACT) is the acronym referencing Avaya "Voice Over IP (VoIP)" products managed via Avaya Communications Manager (ACM) platform.

name: ACV
def: ACV - Actual Cash Value - Cost of replacing damaged or destroyed property with comparable new property, minus depreciation and obsolescence. This valuation method is a claims settlement option for physical damage/loss coverage provided in an insurance policy.

name: ADA
def: ADA - Americans with Disabilities Act - At Nationwide, ADA compliance is about making electronic and information technology accessible to people with disabilities. It is coupled with Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act and mostly refers to accessibility to nationwide.com. To assist visually impaired people who rely on assistive technology, such as screen readers, developers add alt tags to describe images and areas within a webpage that cannot be seen.

name: ADB
def: ADB - Accidental Death Benefit - Insurance benefit which pays a specified dollar amount if the covered party's death is the result of external, violent and accidental means.

name: ADC
def: ADC - Application Development Center

name: ADDS
def: ADDS - Additional Driver Discovery System - A personal auto application to help identify new drivers in a household.

name: ADEN
def: ADEN - Associate Development Exercise Nationwide - ADEN is a dynamic, simulation-based, interactive class that introduces the business side of insurance and builds the business acumen of class participants.

name: ADJGDC
def: ADJGDC - Adjusted Gross Dealer Concession - Gross Dealer Concession less "ticket" charges for brokerage sales (i.e., non-insurance products such as mutual funds and stocks sold through a clearing house). Producer commission is based on the Adjusted Gross Dealer Commission.

name: ADL
def: ADL - Application Development Leader - This person is accountable for the effective and efficient release and delivery of software development and integration projects, as well as for managing the relationship with the engaged BSA. He or she does this by managing, coaching and developing the IT professionals (including both associates and contract staff) who are responsible for implementing such projects.

name: ADP
def: ADP - Application Data Protection - A logical segment on the network where all database resources are being migrated.

name: ADP
def: ADP - Automated Data Processing - Company name of the Claims estimating vendor.

name: ADPIF
def: ADPIF - Acquisition Date Policies in Force - A monthly Affinity policy count metric of any policy that is tagged with an active group after the acquisition date of the group for compensation purposes. For example, Group ABC is acquired on July 1, so that any policy for compensation must have original inception date on or after July 1.

name: ADSL
def: ADSL - Asymetrical Digital Services Line - Network option for high bandwidth access to the Internet from agencies or homes through service providers like AT&T

name: ADSM
def: ADSM - Agency Development Sales Manager - Sales Managers whose primary responsibilities are recruiting and hiring new ACB (Agency Capital Builder) scratch empoloyee agents and managing them to meet certain minimum sales plan requirements.

name: ADW
def: ADW - Allied Data Warehouse - While Allied data is now hosted in the combined P&C Data Warehouse, many applications still interface with the older Allied Data Warehouse

name: AEAP
def: AEAP - Aggregate Expense Allowance Payment - Discontinued compensation practice used by Provident. Paid to Professional Consulting Group (PCG) office managers, part of the Provident exclusive agents, to help offset their office expenses.

name: AEC
def: AEC - Application Enhancement Coordinator - Role within IT

name: AES
def: AES - Application Engineering Solutions

name: AFID
def: AFID - Annexus FI Distributors, LLC - A separate business entity created and owned by Annexus to market products to Nationwide's unprotected firms, and some producers who work with unprotected firms.

name: AG IT
def: AG IT - Allied Group Information Technology - The Allied Group (AG IT) office provides support for many of Nationwide's businesses, including: Allied, Agribusiness, Nationwide Bank, Scottsdale, Titan, Nationwide Advantage Mortgage and Veterinary Pet Insurance (VPI). The Customer Service and Billing cross-company capability area is also a part of AG IT. The office supports a number of distribution channels and product lines, including commercial, farm, specialty and excess and surplus.

name: AGA
def: AGA - Allied General Agency - Allied General Agency

name: AGC
def: AGC - Agency Network - A Traditional Life policy data on-line inquiry system. The system additionally provides inquiry to certain basic Variable Universal Life (VUL) policy data.

name: AGCM
def: AGCM - Agent Gateway Client Management - Exclusive Agents Client Management system. Contains AGM also.

name: AGD
def: AGD - Agent Gateway Desktop - Agent Gateway Desktop is a landing page that provides all the tools necessary for agents to manage customers, research products, service claims, lookup employees, engage in training, and perform a variety of other daily operations.

name: AGIMC
def: AGIMC - Allied Group Insurance Marketing Company - A former Allied organization to market Allied branded insurance products using a direct channel process. Also managed agencies purchased by Allied. Operations were transferred to Nationwide Sales Solutions but various system indicators still use "AGIMC".

name: AGM
def: AGM - Agent Gateway Marketing

name: AGSS
def: AGSS - Agent Gateway Sales and Service - The renovation of the current AOA and NP sales and service applications used by our exclusive and direct channel agents.

name: AH
def: AH - Accident & Health Insurance - Coverage for accidental injury, accidental death or sickness. Benefits include paid hospital expenses, medical expenses, surgical expenses and income payments.

name: AHA
def: AHA - Associates Helping Associates - A program that can provide emergency financial assistance to a Nationwide associate.

name: AHT
def: AHT - Average Handle Time - The amount of seconds it takes on average to handle a contact to completion, including talk time plus after-contact work time.

name: AI
def: AI - Additional Insured - A party not automatically included as an insured under an insurance policy, but for whom the policyholder desires or is required to provide coverage under the policy.

name: AIA
def: AIA - American Insurance Association - AIA is a leading Property & Casualty (P&C) trade organization representing around 300 insurers. AIA provides information to the P&C industry on state and federal regulation and serves as an industry representative.

name: AIMS
def: AIMS - Agent Information Management System - The NF system of record for firm, agent, and advisor information. The primary purpose is to track and manage licensing, appointment, and registration information for NF Producers, and General Agent Agreements for Firms.

name: AIP
def: AIP - Associate Incentive Plan - Associates are eligible to receive a payout based on their performance rating and the company performance based on selected metrics. The formula and metrics used vary year by year. See link on AIP for details on how associates qualify for the incentive.

name: AIP
def: AIP - Automobile Insurance Plan - State provided insurance pool for drivers who have difficulty insuring their auto in the private insurance market because of high risk factors. The policies are usually assigned out by the state regulatory agency to all of the auto insurance companies licensed in the state. The state provided AIP is often the "last resort" for licensed drivers who can't obtain insurance elsewhere. Also referred to as Assigned Risk Insurance Program or Residual Markets.

name: AIPSO
def: AIPSO - Automobile Insurance Plan Servicing Organization - AIPSO is a Third Party Administrator (TPA) for assigned Auto Insurance Plans (AIP) provided to high-risk drivers and assigned out to insurance companies licensed in that state. AIPSO is a non-profit insurance industry organization that provides all of the services required for administration of AIP. Nationwide uses AIPSO for a portion of the AIP states and our systems interface with AIPSO.

name: AIS
def: AIS - Auto Input System - A legacy green screen/batch IMS application for update/addition of auto policies.

name: AIS
def: AIS - Allied Information Services - An early term used to identify Allied IT or MIS group years ago, before partnering with Nationwide.

name: AJE
def: AJE - Accounting Journal Entry - Accounting Journal Entry (AJE) is a system for manual entry of accounting updates into the Oracle/PeopleSoft financials Enterprise General Ledger (EGL). This front-end interface is used by business areas and the accounting department.

name: AKA
def: AKA - Also Known As - Another name for an individual, such as a nickname, alias, pseudonym or maiden name.

name: AKM
def: AKM - Association Key Manager - A system to associate key values from National Platform and ECIF for parties.

name: ALE
def: ALE - Additional Living Expenses Coverage - Provides coverage for the extra expenses incurred maintaining a normal standard of living while the dwelling is untenable, because of damage resulting from a covered loss.

name: ALH
def: ALH - Auto Loss History - Utilization Review Organization (URO) report on the history of losses for a vehicle.

name: ALM
def: ALM - Application Lifecycle Management - This is the acronym associated with the new version of Quality Center (Quality Center - ALM version 11.0 and higher).

name: ALPS
def: ALPS - Automated Loss Prevention System - An internal software system called ALPS (Automated Loss Prevention System) that is used in the Home Care and Loss Control divisions of underwriting in PCIO.

name: ALS
def: ALS - Actual Loss Sustained - Provides coverage for all allowed expenses incurred from a covered loss within timeframe defined by the contract.

name: ALS
def: ALS - Administration Leverage System - ALS - Variable Life Administration System - Administration System which processes primarily variable life insurance policies for NF Individual Protection Systems.

name: ALT
def: ALT - Architecture Leadership Team

name: ALU
def: ALU - Academy of Life Underwriting - The Academy of Life Underwriting (ALU) provides educational opportunities for professional underwriters.

name: AM
def: AM - Asset Management - The combination of tools, processes and organizational interfaces used to manage assets.

name: AME
def: AME - Account Month-End - The last day of the month for reporting. May not be the same as the actual last day of the month.

name: AMF
def: AMF - Agent Master File - (Des Moines Licensing system)

name: AMI
def: AMI - Agency Management Integration

name: AMI
def: AMI - Agency Management Interface - Application that integrates the agency's AMS and policy management tools utilizing Tandem and Ivans. Passes policy information between the agency/company in batch and real-time processing.

name: AML
def: AML - Anti-Money Laundering Laws - Federal laws requiring U.S. financial institutions to assist U.S. government agencies to detect and prevent money laundering.

name: AMP
def: AMP - Accelerating Marketing Productivity - AMP is Marketing & Communication's Financial and Work Flow Marketing Tool

name: AMS
def: AMS - Affinity Marketing Suppression

name: AMS
def: AMS - Agency Management System Authoritative source of record for licensing, contracting, biographical and profile data for Titan agencies and producers. AMS also stores records for Exclusive, Allied, Service Center, and NSS agencies/producers to process policies on the Titan platform.

name: ANCP
def: ANCP - Average Net Claim Payout - (Loss Paid for Period + Salvage for Period + Subrogation for Period) / (Closed Claim Count for Period - CWP Count for Period - Reopen Count for Period). This is done in aggregate and by coverages.

name: ANP
def: ANP - Auto National Platform - A legacy policy system that the states of Illinois, Indiana, Ohio, Virginia and West Virginia used to sale and service standard auto policies.

name: ANSI
def: ANSI - American National Standards Institute - An industry group that focuses upon establishing industry-wide standards for a variety of purposes and disciplines. It is a member of ISO (Industry Standards Organization).

name: AOA
def: AOA - Agency Office Automation - Legacy agency system which allows agents to interface with Nationwide Insurance systems for the purpose of initiating and processing policy transactions.

name: AOI
def: AOI - Amount of Insurance - The limits associated to each coverage provided by an insurance contract.

name: AOS
def: AOS - All Other States - Typically used with state abbreviations to reference all states which have not been previously mentioned.

name: APECS
def: APECS - Abandoned Property Escheatment Compliance System - APECS Multi-Tier is an application for tracking abandoned property (e.g. uncashed checks) from the FiServ Frontier Recon+ application. The app is used for follow up with the check recipient and transfer to the appropriate state agency as set by each state's regulations. This application will be replaced by a newer application called Tracker.

name: API
def: API - Agency Partnership Initiative - A training program that: assists underwriters, sales managers, and others in building better working relationships/partnerships -and- aids in cultivating customer-centricity and sales-mindedness.

name: APIP
def: APIP - Additional Personal Injury Protection - An optional type of no-fault coverage offered for an automobile insurance policy which contains benefit provisions for income continuation, essential services and survivors' compensation.

name: APLUS
def: APLUS - All Personal Lines Underwriting System - Personal Lines Underwriting system

name: APR
def: APR - Agency Production Report - Allows sales/agents to see production growth.

name: APRM
def: APRM - Application Portfolio & Runbook Management - A system for tracking the inventory of all applications and the associated run books. Each application in APRM lists information on the owner, type, description life cycle, vendor, number of users and current status. Can be referenced by aprm.nwie.net or jaws.nwie.net.

name: APS
def: APS - Abandoned Property System - Finance/Treasury application for tracking abandoned property (e.g. uncashed checks) for follow up with check recipient and transfer to state agency based on that state's rules. This mainframe application is tightly coupled to ARP (Account Reconciliation Package) and used for those bank accounts on ARP. APECS (Abandoned Property Escheatment Compliance System) and Tracker applications are used for accounts on Frontier Recon+.

name: APT
def: APT - Agent / Staff Profile Tool - Interface that allows the agency to update their office info in real time. Updates the Producer Data System (PDS).

name: AQB
def: AQB - Auto Quote and Bind - Process of providing an auto quote, then getting a contract (i.e., binding agreement). Bind is insurance industry jargon that should only be used internally.

name: AR
def: AR - Awards & Recognition - Agency application for tracking Awards & Recognition (A&R) qualifications.

name: ARA
def: ARA - Automated Re-Assignment - A legacy claims process used to automatically assign a claims representative to a claim.

name: ARAS
def: ARAS - Auto Risk Analysis System

name: ARCADE
def: ARCADE - Actuarial Research Commerical Area Data Environment - Hierarchical database located in the IDM_Commercial space on Teradata containing PCIO, HV, and Policy Center data from multiple sources built to support advanced analytics for Standard Commercial.

name: ARCS
def: ARCS - Analytics Reporting Cyber Security - Used by Information Risk Management (IRM); an Excel-based dashboard for displaying and filtering vulnerabilities.

name: ARD
def: ARD - Associate Review Database - A performance tool database used by Commercial Processing teams.

name: ARG
def: ARG - Associate Resource Group - Associate Resource groups are available for associates to join and were formed to provide networking, professional development and community involvement opportunities to members; and to actively support the company's business initiatives. If one of the groups interests you, get more information by viewing that group's website or by emailing the contact person.

name: ARM
def: ARM - Adjustable-Rate Mortgage - A type of mortgage loan with a fixed interest rate for an introductory period, and set periods thereafter when the interest rate may be adjusted. The interest rate may increase or decrease, depending on current market conditions.

name: ARP
def: ARP - Account Reconciliation Package - ARP is a legacy check reconciliation system in Finance IT. Primary purpose is to manage select bank checking accounts, allowing interfacing systems and users to place stops, cancel and track payments of checks. Mainframe system from Checkfree vendor uses CICS front-end, bringing in batch files from external banking institutes. This application was replaced by FiServ Checkfree Frontier Recon+ on the distributed platform, however some bank accounts remain on the legacy application.

name: AS
def: AS - Agency Solutions

name: ASA
def: ASA - Associate of the Society of Actuaries - An actuary who has completed the requirements for an intermediate degree of attainment for the Society of Actuaries.

name: ASC
def: ASC - Associate Service Center

name: ASCP
def: ASCP - Agent Security Compensation Plan - The term used to refer to retirement plans offered to Nationwide Exclusive Agents. It is comprised of Deferred Compensation Incentive Credits and Extended Renewal Commissions.

name: ASDm
def: ASDm - Accelerated Solution Delivery methodology - Part of the ITDM 2020 initiative, ASDm is one part of multiple work streams that significantly update Nationwide's technology development and implementation capabilities enabling acceleration of processes while maintaining appropriate controls.

name: ASL
def: ASL - Aggregate Stop Loss - A type of coverage that protects an employer's maximum exposure to its group health claims that goes into effect when the total of these claims attains a certain level, typically 125% of its annual projected group health claim costs.

name: ASLOB
def: ASLOB - Annual Statement Line of Business - An accounting report grouped by industry-standard product categories.

name: ASM
def: ASM - Application Services Manager

name: ASOF
def: ASOF - Audit Statement of Finding - A report detailing the results of an assessment as to the potential risk exposure to the company.

name: ASPEN
def: ASPEN - Allied Systems Personal Lines Entry - A semi-obsolete Allied desktop application used by agent for policy entry to upload to Allied mainframe and download back to itself. Mainframe part of process is still used for uploading bulk agency transfers and converting from other systems.

name: ASR
def: ASR - Auto Systems Release - The grouping of application changes for personal auto systems.

name: ASRS
def: ASRS - Automated Suitability Review System - An application designed to provide control over the review of an insurance application for its suitability to a policyholder or consumer.

name: ASRS
def: ASRS - Account Statistical Record Structure - NI legacy mainframe flow for processing for report purposes the premiums, claims and stats (counts).

name: ASU
def: ASU - AGENCY SUPPORT UNIT

name: ATDD
def: ATDD - Acceptance Test Driven Development - Acceptance Test Driven Development (ATDD) is a form of Test Driven Development (TDD) which focuses on creating tests at a business requirements level prior to beginning development of the defined functionality. It should not replace, but rather be used in conjunction with functional unit level testing.

name: ATE
def: ATE - Application Test Environment - Application Test Environment

name: ATIN
def: ATIN - Adoption Taxpayer Identification Number - A temporary identification number issued by the IRS to individuals who are in the process of legally adopting a U.S. citizen or resident but who cannot get a Social Security Number (SSN) for that child in time to file their tax return.

name: ATTY
def: ATTY - Attorney

name: ATV
def: ATV - All Terrain Vehicle - Any self-propelled vehicle which is manufactured for sale to be operated primarily on private property / insured premises, off-highway trails or off-highway competitions and only incidentally operated on public highways. Excludes snowmobiles.

name: AU
def: AV - Assessed Value - Estimated value for real or personal property established by a taxing entity.

name: AUM
def: AUM - Assets Under Management - The dollar value of all of the Nationwide Funds being managed by Nationwide Investment Management Group.

name: AUS
def: AUS - Auto Underwriting System - The underwriting application for personal auto.

name: AVATAR
def: AVATAR - Aggregated View of Appointments, Training and Relationships - A look-up tool designed to consolidate and filter insurance licensing and appointment information (Nationwide Financial) for presentation to front-line associates in a format that simplifies producer-level licensing details.

name: AVP
def: AVP - Associate Vice President

name: AWD
def: AWD - Automated Workflow Distributor - A comprehensive business process management (BPM) solution product from DST Systems, Inc. (DST) used in work queues for P&C policy, claims, screening and underwriting processes.

name: AWE
def: AWE - Alternative Work Environment - Telecommuting and work at home arrangements

name: AWP
def: AWP - Agency Web Pages - The home pages for Nationwide exclusive agencies.

name: AWS
def: AWS - Alternative Workplace Solutions - Alternative Workplace Solutions (AWS) are alternatives that may be available in certain circumstances to provide scheduling and work location flexibility that best meets the needs of associates, managers, and the organization. The AWS Guide provides managers and associates with policies and guidelines on the various AWS options. Please contact your manager or human resource professional if you have any questions.

name: AWS
def: AWS - Amazon Web Services - A cloud platform provided by Amazon.com. Web services are sometimes called cloud services or remote computing services. The first AWS offerings were launched in 2006 to provide online services for websites and client-side applications.

name: AY
def: AY - Accident Year - The year in which an insured event occurs. It is not dependent upon when the event (accident) is reported or when the loss is paid.

name: B2E
def: B2E - Business to Employee - A business-to-employee interface in which products are sold by a company to their employees.

name: BA
def: BA - Business Auto - Commercial insurance covering bodily injury, property damage and liability exposures for vehicles used in a business context.

name: BABOK
def: BABOK - A Guide to the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge - "A Guide to the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge" is a globally recognized standard for the practice of business analysis. The BABOK Guide describes business analysis areas of knowledge, their associated activities and tasks, and the skills necessary to be effective in their execution. (Published by IIBA)

name: BAC
def: BAC - Business Availability Center

name: BAD
def: BAD - Business Alignment Document

name: BAM
def: BAM - Billing Account Management - The Agency interface to National Billing Platform (NBP) for updates to customer billing.

name: BAO
def: BAO - Business Application Owner - A business role who represents the interests of all business stakeholders of an application or application suite, aligned with a specific IT development line. Typically works across projects, programs and releases, and communicates the business vision and objectives to the IT development line.

name: BAS
def: BAS - Building Automation System - Used by Corporate Real Estate. IT applications that monitor and/or control building operational systems.

name: BAT
def: BAT - Business Advisory Team - Representatives from core business areas provide business requirements and drive initiatives.

name: BC
def: BC - Business Continuity - An operational imperative that defines critical business functions a company must quickly recover to avoid data loss in an outage.

name: BCP
def: BCP - Best of Claims Practices

name: BCS
def: BCS - Business Component Services - Published interfaces to "Service Offerings" of reusable business functionality.

name: BD
def: BD - Broker Dealer - A company that is in the business of buying and selling securities -- stocks, bonds, mutual funds, and certain other investment products -- on behalf of its customers (as broker), for its own account (as dealer), or both.

name: BDD
def: BDD - Behavior Driven Development - "... agile software development technique devised by Dan North[1] as a response to the issues he encountered whilst teaching Test-Driven Development."

name: BDE
def: BDE - Business Delivery Executive - Program management role, responsible for ensuring achievement of what is defined in the business case.

name: BEAM
def: BEAM - Business Enterprise Affinity Management

name: BGA
def: BGA - Brokerage General Agent - The intermediary role in which a Brokerage General Agency functions, on behalf of their own clients or on behalf of independent Producers and their clients, to transact business with an insurance carrier.

name: BGA
def: BGA - Brokerage General Agency - An independent firm which has contractual relationships with multiple insurance carriers to sell the carriers' products to consumers either directly or through the firm's relationships with independent producers.

name: BI
def: BI - Bodily Injury - A type of liability insurance coverage that provides benefits to anyone injured other than the insured to which the policyholder is considered liable. This coverage typically addresses injury, sickness, disease or death sustained by the other person.

name: BI
def: BI - Business Intelligence - An umbrella term that includes the applications, infrastructure and tools, and best practices that enable access to and analysis of information to improve and optimize decisions and performance.

name: BIC
def: BIC - Business Income Coverage - Commercial property insurance covering loss of income suffered by a business when damage to its premises by a covered cause of loss causes a slowdown or suspension of its operations.

name: BIN
def: BIN - Broker Identification Number - A unique number assigned by a distributor (i.e. Broker Dealer) to their representative for identification purposes.

name: BIO
def: BIO - Business Integration Office - Business area representation for integration efforts.

name: BIUM
def: BIUM - Bodily Injury Uninsured Motorist - A type of coverage that may provide benefits to the insured to address bodily injury in the case where the other party involved is liable but does not have insurance or cannot be located.

name: BLM
def: BLM - Bureau of Labor Statistics - Principal fact-finding agency for the federal government in the broad field of labor economics and statistics.

name: BOB
def: BOB - Best of Breed - The top alternative among multiple solutions (e.g., vendor, software or application).

name: BOB
def: BOB - Big Open Biographical Database - Centralized repository for all Nationwide Insurance Sales agent program participation in Lotus Notes.

name: BOD
def: BOD - Beginning of Day - The Beginning Of Day web application is a web-enabled offshoot of the old AOA application. It is a reporting application which is accessible only by the Exclusive Agency work force. It primarily displays business activity (policy/account activity) at an agency level for the past week. The name derives from the fact that agents typically check their activity as soon as they arrive at work in the morning.

name: BOLI
def: BOLI - Bank Owned Life Insurance

name: BOM
def: BOM - Business Operational Model

name: BOM
def: BOM - Bill of Materials - Build release information received from developers (I.e., release notes).

name: BOP
def: BOP - Businessowners Policy - A type of insurance policy that protects the interests of a business owner and usually consists of a package of property, liability and business interruption coverages in one policy that target different aspects of certain types of business.

name: BOSS
def: BOSS - Business Operations System Support - BOSS is the common interface for CDM, Track Products, OEadminControl, and DSA.

name: BP
def: BP - Bill of Particulars

name: BPM
def: BPM - Business Process Management/Business Process Modeling

name: BPO
def: BPO - Business Partner Outsourcing - Nationwide's contractual agreement for services with a vendor that may or may not have a specified number of resources. These outsourced resources aren't part of Nationwide's workforce and aren't counted in associate or contractor headcount.

name: BPP
def: BPP - Business Personal Property - Property located in or on the buildings (or structures) at the described premises or in the open (or in a vehicle) within 1000 feet of the described premises.

name: BPR
def: BPR - Business Process Re-engineering - Organizational process that helps identify fundamental business objectives and strategy to reach objectives.

name: BPS
def: BPS - Business Processing System - A customer system owned by Finance for the purpose of managing chargebacks and allocations.

name: BPS

Every MA state-licensed company is required to become a member of CAR.

This practice of frequently checking in and unit testing code prevents breaking it. -- from ADC Standards (via iDrive)
