def: DMRO - Des Moines Regional Operations

name: DMU
def: DMU - Discovery Management Unit - The Discovery Management Unit (DMU) provides a discovery support function to our in-house matter responsible attorneys and compliance professionals. The primary areas of support are class actions, corporate and contingent liability litigation, employment charges and suits and Nationwide Financial regulatory inquiries as well as providing legal support and counsel to the Office of Records and Information Management. The DMU handles the Service of Process function for the Nationwide Companies.

name: DNC
def: DNC - Do Not Call - Also known as DNC Quick Check. Nationwide's telemarketing compliance tool that is made available to Nationwide agencies. Reference: http://agency.ent.nwie.net/DataPrivacyandSecurity/DoNotCallPolicy.asp for more information.

name: DNOC
def: DNOC - Direct Notice of Cancellation - A company-initiated letter to the insured, per state guidelines, that the policy will be cancelled. Used for non-payment of premium due or for bound submissions that are outside of our risk appetite / have unfavorable loss experience.

name: DNS
def: DNS - Did Not Start - Termination reason used for associates who were hired, but never actually started and were not counted as associates. Those with a DNS indicator are excluded from turnover because the person was never employed.

name: DNS
def: DNS - Domain Name System - Service that provides name resolution to IP address for IT network components.

name: DNS
def: DNS - Do Not Schedule - Used on calendars when time needs to be blocked out and should not be scheduled over for other meetings/appointments.

name: DO
def: DO - District Office

name: DOC
def: DOC - Drive Other Car - An endorsement which extends insurance protection to a policyholder when she/he drives cars other than her/his own.

name: DOFE
def: DOFE - Date of First Exposure

name: DOI
def: DOI - Department of Insurance

name: DOL
def: DOL - Date of Loss - Date an accident occurred or any other loss

name: DOL
def: DOL - Department of Labor - The federal agency responsible for administering and enforcing a large quantity of federal labor laws, including, but not limited to, overtime pay, child labor, wages and hours, workplace health and safety, FMLA, and various other employee rights.

name: DOT
def: DOT - Department of Transportation - Federal agency chartered to regulate America's highways and transportation venues.

name: DPIM
def: DPIM - Distribution Partner Information Management - An InfoSphere MDM asset for the purpose of storing distribution partner data.

name: DPN
def: DPN - Distribution Partner Number - A unique number assigned by DPIM (Distribution Partner Information Management), to identify each distribution partner.

name: DPS
def: DPS - Disbursement Processing System - Check-processing applications, including ARP and APECS.

name: DPS
def: DPS - Data Provisioning Solutions - Part of Enterprise Information Management. DPS hosts Informatica PowerCenter, Informatica Data Quality, IBM Change Data Capture, Denodo Data Virtualization, and IBM Business Glossary.

name: DR
def: DR - Disaster Recovery - The ability to recover processing at a different site if a disaster destroys the primary site or otherwise renders it inoperable. A DR plan covers both the hardware and software required to run critical business applications and associated processes, and to (functionally) recover a complete site.

name: DRM
def: DRM - Data Relationship Management - An Oracle Hyperion application that manages all reference data and reporting hierarchies.

name: DRPM
def: DRPM - Demand, Resource & Portfolio Management - An integrated set of policies, processes, procedures and tools. Their combined goal is to capture IT resource capacity and demand data in Clarity, and use it to manage variances, risks and issues that could impact Nationwide's IT delivery.

name: DSM
def: DSM - Des Moines - Capital city of Iowa. Headquarters for Allied Insurance. DSM is a common abbreviation used for denoting this location or systems based in independent channel processes; it is also the airport code for the Des Moines airport.

name: DSM
def: DSM - District Sales Manager

name: DSO
def: DSO - Director Sales Operations

name: DSPF
def: DSPF - Document Solutions Print Finish

name: DSR
def: DSR - Distributed Server Refresh

name: DSRA
def: DSRA - Delivery Services Requirements Analysis - Delivery Services Requirements Analysis Per Yammer

name: DSS
def: DSS - Decision Support System - Applications emphasizing user-friendliness and ad hoc query, reporting and analytical capabilities

name: DSSI
def: DSSI - Direct Sales and Service Initiatives

name: DSSI
def: DSSI is a set of interrelated projects designed to provide associates with the tools and training to deliver a best-in-class, personalized customer experience.

name: DTCC
def: DTCC - Depository Trust & Clearing Corporation - A clearing agency. Through its subsidiaries, DTCC provides clearing, settlement and information services for equities, corporate and municipal bonds, government and mortgage-backed securities, money market instruments and over-the-counter derivatives.

name: DTO
def: DTO - Dev Test Optimization - A program in Nationwide IT to enhance the process of development and testing.

name: DTOP
def: DTOP - Damage To Other Property - Damages caused to property belonging to another party.

name: DW
def: DW - Data Warehouse

name: DWP
def: DWP - Direct Written Premium - The premiums to be received from a policyholder for the term of coverage of the policy based on the effective date. Direct indicates the premium was written on our insurance company's paper and has not been adjusted for assumptions or cessions of premiums with reinsurers.

name: DWU
def: DWU - Data Warehouse & Underwriting

name: DWUAC
def: DWUAC - Data Warehouse & Underwriting Advisory Council

name: E&SS
def: E&SS - Excess and Surplus Specialty - The E&S market enables consumers to purchase insurance coverages unavailable in the standard or admitted market. These are generally distressed, unique or high capacity risks such as start-ups, mobile home communities and coastal properties. The difficult risks accepted by surplus lines carriers require innovative underwriting and expertise.

name: E2E
def: E2E - End 2 End - The custom-built reconciliation tool used to ensure that all general ledger data was propagated downstream between NWFIN, EPM, Finance Data Warehouse and Finance Data Mart.

name: EA
def: EA - Enterprise Architecture - Describes the structure and inter-relationship between key aspects of business and IT within an enterprise. Includes aspects of business planning (strategic) such as goals, visions, strategies, and capabilities; aspects of business operation such as organization, business functions, processes, and products; aspects of information systems such as applications and databases; and aspects of enabling technological infrastructure such as servers and network.

name: EA
def: EA - Exclusive Agency - A type of distribution partner organization using exclusive agents for producers.

name: EA
def: EA - Enterprise Applications - A wide range of applications that run across the enterprise in a wide variety of functions including HR, Legal, Finance, Investments, Associate apps, Collaboration and many shared service apps. Formally known as Corporate Applications (CA)

name: EAC
def: EAC - Estimate at Completion - The baselined planned resource hours which are used as a comparison against actual hours for a variance percentage.

name: EAFSS
def: EAFSS - Exclusive Agency Financial Sales Specialist - Associate agent who sells financial products only in a Nationwide agency.

name: EASE
def: EASE - Enterprise Affinity Solution Enablement - Multi-year initiative to create an centralized affinity platform, with a central repository and service, designed to improve affinity members' and agents' experiences and improve Nationwide Affinity Solutions' efficiency.

name: EBI
def: EBI - Enterprise Boat Integration - Integration of Allied's Watercraft production with other Nationwide distribution channels.

name: EBI
def: EBI - Electronic Business Intelligence - A data warehouse IT system that provides data used to analyze business trends in sales.

name: EBPP
def: EBPP - Electronic Bill Payment & Presentment - Interfaces with NBP and other applications for presentment and payment of premiums.

name: EBR
def: EBR - Established Business Relationship - A previous or current relationship formed between a seller, i.e., Nationwide, and a consumer based on that consumer's purchase or transaction with the seller.

name: EBT
def: EBT - Examination Before Trial

name: EC
def: EC - Extended Coverage - An endorsement which extends a Standard Fire Policy to cover loss caused by the following perils: windstorm, hail, explosion (except by steam boilers), riots, civil commotion, aircraft, vehicles, and smoke.

name: EC
def: EC - Exclusive Channel - Insurance agent that works exclusively with Nationwide.

name: ECAF
def: ECAF - Exclusive Channel Agency Facing

name: ECC
def: ECC - Enterprise Command Center

name: EchoSign
def: EchoSign - Electronic signature service - EchoSign is an electronic signature service that allows our members to electronically sign and return form(s) in minutes rather than days. EchoSign provides services to e-mail form(s) to a member.

name: ECIB
def: ECIB - Electronic Customer Information Broker - An enterprise (ECTO) level effort to consolidate customer information into one place.

name: ECIF
def: ECIF - Enterprise Customer Information File - An application for collection of customer and party information. Maintains a "single view of a customer" (SVOC) across the Nationwide enterprise, whether the customer is a person or an organization.

name: ECN
def: ECN - Enterprise Customer Number - A unique number that is assigned to a party which identifies that party throughout the Nationwide family of companies.

name: ECS
def: ECS - Elastic Cloud Storage - Dell Elastic Cloud Storage is a software-defined, cloud-scale, object storage platform.

name: ECTO
def: ECTO - Enterprise Chief Technology Officer

name: EDC
def: EDC - East Data Center - The Data Center East is a 112,000 sf facility located on 45 acres in New Albany, Ohio. The Data Center will provide up to 2,400kW of necessary electrical power capacity to support projected future IT growth needs. Data Center East is a Tier IV facility which means it has the highest recognized degree of fault tolerance and concurrent maintainability. This means any system or component can incur a fault or be taken out of service for maintenance without interruption of the critical IT load.

name: EDDA
def: EDDA - Electronic Document Delivery Agreement - An agreement (executed by customers electronically or physically) that is used to obtain a customer's consent to obtain electronic delivery of certain documents and to provide the key disclosures that are required prior to obtaining such consent.

name: EDG
def: EDG - Electronic Data Gathering - A natural language query application that supports ad hoc reporting for policy and claims data for underwriting purposes. It updates CPS databases and populates claim information into its database.

name: EDG
def: EDG - Enterprise Data Governance - Vision: For Nationwide's data to be a trusted, integrated, shared, and assessable enterprise asset that enables data driven decisions and increase speed to market. Mission: To ensure data is managed in a way that promotes appropriate understanding, quality, integrity, and security while minimizing cross-domain risks.

name: EDI
def: EDI - Electronic Data Interchange

name: EDO
def: EDO - Enterprise Data Office - Office of the Chief Data Officer, serving One Nationwide's objectives by providing high-quality data efficiently and effectively.

name: EDS
def: EDS - Edit Daily System - Edit Daily is a system and process that verifies statistical/pricing and other record fields via the stat record used by all Commercial, CLT, Billing, related claims applications processes and Service Advantage. These edits ensure that all downstream applications receive valid data via the stat records. The edits for this data are governed by the RDN and are documented in the On-line Coding Manual.

name: EEO
def: EEO - Equal Employment Opportunity - A policy statement that equal consideration for a job is applicable to all individuals and that the employer does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, marital status, national origin, disability or sex.

name: EFT
def: EFT - Electronic Funds Transfer - The use of electronic means such as computers, telephones, magnetic tape, etc. rather than checks in order to move money.

name: EFTS
def: EFTS - Enterprise File Transport System - IBM Sterling platform used to send secure file transfers in and out of Nationwide to external vendors or internally exchange files between Nationwide business teams.

name: EGL
def: EGL - Enterprise General Ledger - The Enterprise General Ledger also known as G/L is hosted in the Oracle/PeopleSoft ERP application.

name: EIA
def: EIA - Equity-Indexed Annuity

name: EIN
def: EIN - Employer Identification Number - Also known as a federal tax identification number, an EIN is used to identify a business entity. It is also used by estates and trusts which have income which is required to be reported on Form 1041, U.S. Income Tax Return for Estates and Trusts.

name: EIS
def: EIS - Executive Information System - A mainframe (VM) based system for high-level reporting of NI operational results.

name: EL
def: EL - Employers Liability - Coverage against common law liability of an employer for accidents to employees, as distinguished from liability imposed by a workers' compensation law.

name: ELP
def: ELP - Estimated Loss Potential - ISO's best estimate of what the cost of losses will be for the average risk within a given classification.

name: ELS
def: ELS - Enterprise Logging Solution - Enterprise Logging Solution, ArcSight, is being replaced for infrastructure logging by QRadar by mid-2013.

name: EMP
def: EMP - Event Management Program

name: EMP
def: EMP is for managing the data privacy and security breach events.

name: ENS
def: ENS - Excess and Surplus - Insurance coverage (sold by Scottsdale)

name: ENTRACK
def: ENTRACK - Enterprise Environment and Deployment Tracking System Products Suite - The ENTRACK System Suite consists of a myriad of enterprise systems, organized and modularized to provide cohesive functionality, sharing, re-usability, and modularization. It is specifically architected to serve as a repository for the enterprise, to execute simultaneous multiple deployment successfully and efficiently; it is the data owner for and used extensively to track/manage Enterprise Infrastructure, Network, and Business (Office of Agency and Claims).

name: EOD
def: EOD - End of Day (Agency) - Processes executed after the close of the agency business day.

name: EOI
def: EOI - Evidence of Insurance

name: EOM
def: EOM - End of Message - Often used in the subject line of an email to indicate there is no message content.

name: EPIS
def: EPIS - Externally Provided IT Services - All cloud computing or external hosting engagements must follow the process outlined in the External Cloud Process Overview document. Furthermore, no external cloud or external hosting servicing arrangement is to be used for work involving Nationwide data until a Supply Management Services (SMS) and Information Technology (IT) review (including Architecture, Information Risk Management, and Privacy) has been conducted of the solution and the provider; and until a contractual agreement has been

name: EPLI
def: EPLI - Employment Practice Liability - Company insurance coverage and associated costs to protect against claims/suits made against a company.

name: EPM&A
def: EPM&A - Enterprise Performance Management & Analysis

name: EPRS
def: EPRS - Elevated Privilege Request System - Exception request system for Administrative Privileges on a Nationwide laptop or workstation. Administrative Privileges will not be approved unless daily job functions will be inhibited by the lack of this access.

name: EQ
def: EQ - Earthquake Coverage - Property coverages for losses resulting from a sudden trembling or shaking of the earth, including that caused by volcanic eruption. Excluded are losses resulting from fire, explosion, flood or tidal wave following the covered event.

name: ERAC
def: ERAC - Enterprise Rent-A-Car - A nickname for Enterprise, Nationwide's preferred car rental agency.

name: ERD
def: ERD - Executive Role Description - Job description document used for posting Executive Level positions. These documents are managed by Executive Compensation for use by HR Business partners and Talent Acquisition.

name: ERISA
def: ERISA - Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 - A federal law that sets minimum standards for pension plans in private industry.

name: ERM
def: ERM - Enterprise Risk Management

name: ERM
def: ERM - Enterprise Resource Management - Umbrella term encompassing resource planning tools, including PeopleSoft HR.

name: ERP
def: ERP - Enterprise Resource Planning - Enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems integrate internal and external management information across an entire organization, embracing finance/accounting, sales and service, customer relationship and talent management, etc. ERP systems automate this activity with an integrated software application (ex. PeopleSoft). Their purpose is to facilitate the flow of information between all business functions inside the boundaries of the organization and manage the connections to outside stakeholders.

name: ERS
def: ERS - Emergency Road Service - The vehicle coverage for towing, labor and related services.

name: ESA
def: ESA - Electronic Services Agreement - An agreement to abide by the rules governing Internet server access with a particular company (e.g., Nationwide).

name: ESAS
def: ESAS - Enterprise Security and Accounting - On-demand investment reporting and batch financial reports; replaced Investment Data System (IDS).

name: ESI
def: ESI - Electronically Stored Information - Relevant to a lawsuit requiring the production of documentation, ESI is information created, altered, communicated, stored, or utilized in electronic form, though the use of computer hardware and software. E.g. E-mail, instant messages, web browsing history, Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint documents, data from CLASS, Passport, J-Claim, NAPS, HRIS, Filenet, or Data Warehouse.

name: ESOP
def: ESOP - Employee Stock Ownership Retirement Plan - A defined contribution retirement plan that is a stock bonus plan or a stock bonus/ money purchase plan. An ESOP must be designed to invest primarily in qualifying employer securities as required by the Internal Revenue Code (IRC). The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) and Department of Labor (DOL) share jurisdiction over some ESOP features

name: ESP
def: ESP - Enterprise System Platform - ESP is a term used interchangeably with CA Workload Automation at NW.

name: ESPP
def: ESPP - Employee Stock Purchase Plan - An employer-run program in which participating employees can purchase shares of their employer's stock, usually at a discount of up to 15%. Employees contribute to the plan through after-tax payroll deductions.

name: ESS
def: ESS - Employee Self Service - ESS (Employee Self Service) is an employee interface to ServiceNow. It is used for reporting non-critical issues and requests. Users many also check the status of their existing ServiceNow incidents and requests here.

name: ESS
def: ESS - Excess & Surplus/Specialty - Excess & Surplus is typically abbreviated as E&S, but ESS is used in email groups and systems that do not permit the ampersand symbol.

name: ESTAR
def: ESTAR - Electronic Sales Tracking And Reporting

name: ETL
def: ETL - Extract, Transformation & Load - Informatica PowerCerter is used in Nationwide for any ETL requirement. This tool can connect disparate data sources and targets. During data movement between data source(s) and target(s) you can do the transformation ( apply business logic ). Sources or Target could be Oracle, Teradata, Netezza, DB2, FlatFiles, MS-SQL server, XML, etc.

name: ETL
def: ETL - Early Term Loss - Claims investigation for a loss which occurs early after policy inception

name: EUDT
def: EUDT - End User Down Time - The process of measuring Business Impact by capturing the end user "pain" of an incident. EUDT = Active Users x % of Users x Dependency x Duration x Severity

name: EULA
def: EULA - End User License Agreement - If you accept its terms, the EULA gives permission to use the software and grants some additional rights. The EULA also imposes certain restrictions on your use of the software.

name: EUO
def: EUO - Examination Under Oath

name: EVT
def: EVT - Enterprise Validation Technology - Point-of-Sale technology to identify potential fraud prior to binding a policy. Specific errors found in an application will send an alert message to the agent informing them of a discrepancy. This minimizes early term losses from falsified information.

name: EW
def: EW - External Wholesaler

name: FA
def: FA - Fixed Account - An investment option that is funded by the general account of Nationwide. The objective of the fixed account is to provide a low-risk investment within our products.

name: FAC
def: FAC - Flexible Annuity Commission - An NF Commission system designed with similar features to the internal PALLM commission subsystem. Current state, this NF system supports commission processing for the single premium immediate annuity product administered by iCube.

name: FAQ
def: FAQ - Frequently Asked Question

name: FASAD
def: FASAD - Foundations of Application Security Analysis and Design

name: FASB
def: FASB - Financial Accounting Standards Board - Independent board responsible for establishing and interpreting generally accepted accounting principles. It was formed in 1973 to succeed and continue the activities of the Accounting Principles Board (APB),

name: FB
def: FB - Farm Bureau - A private, dues-paying organization comprised of a state's county Farm Bureau organizations. Members help advance the public interest in agriculture and participate in legislation, public information, and education programs.

name: FC
def: FC - Financial Controller - A role to manage expenses and income. There is also a Financial Controller department.

name: FC
def: FC - Family Compensation - A coverage that pays medical expenses for persons injured while riding in the insured vehicle that is involved in an accident. It also pays a confinement benefit (hospital) and in case of death, a death benefit.

name: FCAS
def: FCAS - Fellow of the Casualty Actuarial Society - An actuary who has completed all of the requirement of the FCAS designation. This is the highest level of membership in the Casualty Actuarial Society.

name: FCR
def: FCR - First Contact Resolution - Workforce management term used to identify first contact resolution. Also sometimes referred to as First Call Resolution.

name: FCS
def: FCS - Field Compensation System - This NF system processes and maintains compensation data and associated accounting for producers. Maintains producer information and hierarchy. FCS has three primary functions: licensing & registration, carrier commissions, and distributor commissions.

name: FDIC
def: FDIC - Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation - A government corporation that insures the deposits of all national and state banks that are members of the Federal Reserve System.

name: FDMRS
def: FDMRS - Finance Data Management Request System - The workflow tool built on IBM's Workflow application, used to submit changes for reference data, Finance interface rules, AAM, etc. Requests are routed for completion and can be approved for processing, or rejected based on various reasons.

name: FEP
def: FEP - Fair Employment Practice - Federal, state and municipal laws designed to bar discrimination in conditions of employment.

name: FI
def: FI - Financial Institution - A financial services industry term. An establishment that focuses on dealing with financial transactions, such as investments, loans and deposits.

name: FIA
def: FIA - Fixed Indexed Annuity

name: FID
def: FID - First Insured Date - The date insurance coverage first started for a policyholder.

name: FIFO
def: FIFO - First In First Out - System in which the first records or tasks entered are executed first.

name: FIL
def: FIL - Finance Integration Layer - Application responsible for centralizing Business Rule Management and enforce data quality standards across the Finance Integrated Back Office (FIBO), as well as other systems in the Enterprise that are concerned with Accounting Rules or related Finance functions. It consists of these main components: BRES- Business Rules Engine BRMS- Business Rules Management System SI- Source Integrator SIR- Source Intergrator Reporting Rule Testing Suite - Rule Runner & QTP for testing business rules

name: FINRA
def: FINRA - Financial Industry Regulatory Authority - The largest independent regulator for all firms in the securities industry doing business in the United States. FINRA's mission is to protect America's investors by making sure the securities industry operates fairly and honestly.

name: FIRM
def: FIRM - Finance Integrated Rules Management - The Finance Business Rules Execution Server performs business rule processing for the Finance Integrated Back Office environment. This includes the financial PeopleSoft modules of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Enterprise Financials (EFIN).

name: FIT
def: FIT - Finance IT

name: FIT
def: FIT - Firm Information Tool - A Nationwide Financial (NF) operational application which provides details of a Firm's specific General Agent (GA) Agreement at the Home Office Number level of detail.

name: FIT
def: FIT - Federal Income Tax - Annual tax on income levied by the federal government.

name: FKA
def: FKA - Formerly Known As

name: FLMI
def: FLMI - Fellow, Life Management Institute

name: FLRP
def: FLRP - Financial Leadership Rotation Program

name: FLSA
def: FLSA - Fair Labor Standards Act - Provides guidelines on employment status, child labor, minimum wage, overtime pay and record-keeping requirements for public agencies and businesses engaged in interstate commerce or providing goods and services for commerce.

name: FMLA
def: FMLA - Family Medical Leave Act - A federally mandated time off program that provides associates with an opportunity to balance their work and family life by taking reasonable unpaid leave for certain family and medical reasons.

name: FNOL
def: FNOL - First Notice Of Loss - When we get called by a member to inform us they wish to file a claim. I think this starts a clock that requires action from us (NW) within a certain amount of time.

name: FOP
def: FOP - Fire Online Processing - Personal Property legacy system's green screen interface for Fire Processing System (FPS).

name: FORR
def: FORR - Fellowship of Rings Road (teamroom) - An agile development line operating in the Corporate Internet BSA

name: FPS
def: FPS - Fire Processing System - A Nationwide Insurance legacy policy administration system for personal fire lines, handling policy issuance, renewal, and maintenance.

name: FRC
def: FRC - Financial Responsibility Certificate - Document confirming future financial responsibility for a driver whose driving privileges have been suspended due to certain judgments (varies by state) which require the driver to maintain proof of future financial responsibility for a specified period.

name: FRC
def: FRC - Financial Reporting Controls - Management is responsible for internal controls relevant to the preparation of financial statements that are free from material misstatement. Issues identified by management, Internal Audit and KPMG are reviewed and evaluated for potential financial statement impact. FRC facilitates review of key processes identified to ensure the accuracy and flow of financial data, which are then certified by management.

name: FRQ
def: FRQ - Fire Rate Quote - A Nationwide legacy system for property insurance rate quoting.

name: FS
def: FS - Freedom Specialty - Freedom Specialty Insurance Company, a company within E&S Specialty, is a wholly owned subsidiary of Nationwide. FS specializes in the processing of Specialty Liability insurance, including Directors and Officers (D&O) insurance. The main office is located in 7 World Trade Center, New York, NY.

name: FSA
def: FSA - Flexible Spending Account - Nationwide benefits offering that is a reimbursement/spending account designed to help associates fund their out-of-pocket health care or dependent day care expenses on a tax favored basis.

name: FSA
def: FSA - Fellow of the Society of Actuaries - An actuary who has completed the requirements for the highest degree of attainment for the Society of Actuaries.

name: FSC
def: FSC - Farm Service Center

name: FSR
def: FSR - Field Service Representative

name: FSS
def: FSS - Financial Settlement Services - Settles physical injury claims with a plan "structured" to meet specific needs.

name: FSS
def: FSS - Fire Sale System - One of the interfaces into Fire Processing System (FPS) for entry of new property business.

name: FSSC
def: FSSC - Finance Shared Services Center - The area that provides accounting, reporting and business necessity services to Nationwide associates to enable them to make informed and timely business decisions.

name: FTC
def: FTC - Fire, Theft and Comprehensive - Coverage for damage to the insured's vehicle caused by a storm, vandalism, theft, or accident with an animal.

name: FTE
def: FTE - Full Time Equivalent - A metric used to measure employees based on hours worked.

name: FTP
def: FTP - File Transfer Protocol - A standard network protocol used to transfer files from one host or to another host over a TCP-based network, such as the Internet.

name: FUS
def: FUS - Fire Underwriting System - Stores Underwriting data - Creates referrals for underwriters - Allows to establish communication between agent and underwriter

name: GAAP
def: GAAP - Generally Accepted Accounting Principles - Accounting principles accepted by both the accounting profession and public. Conventions, rules, and procedures that define accepted accounting practice, including board guidelines as well as detailed procedures.

name: GAP
def: GAP - Guideline Annual Premium - See Guideline Level Premium (GLP).

name: GDPR
def: GDPR - General Data Protection Regulation - Effective May 2018, this is a set of rules by which the European Union (EU) intends to standardize data protection requirements for all personal data for individuals within its borders.

name: GEDAC
def: GEDAC - Greet, Engage, Discover, Act, and Close - A flow of interaction with a customer

name: GIC
def: GIC - Guaranteed Investment Contract - A contract which provides that the contract holder places funds on deposit with the insurance company and the insurance company repays the contract holder's deposits plus interest at a guaranteed rate according to a schedule specified in the contract.

name: GIS
def: GIS - Geographic Information System - The tool has been upgraded to include an actual map. Any feedback can be sent to GIS_Team@nationwide.com. Check out the GIS group on Yammer too.

name: GK
def: GK - GateKeeper - A service center representative who is assigned to do the follow-up work of a specific team, or group of service center representatives.

name: GKLL
def: GKLL - Garagekeepers Legal Liability - Garagekeepers legal liability provides coverage for the non-owned autos in an insured's care/custody/control for which they are legally liable.

name: GL
def: GL - General Ledger - Also referred to as GL or EGL (Enterprise General Ledger), for Nationwide the EGL is hosted on the Oracle/PeopleSoft ERP application.

name: GL
def: GL - General Liability (commercial lines) - Insurance protecting Commercial & Farm insureds from most liability exposures other than automobile, Workers Compensation, and professional liability.

name: GLB
def: GLB - Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act aka Financial Services Modernization Act of 1999 - Major components put into place to govern the collection, disclosure, and protection of consumer nonpublic personal information; or personally identifiable information. (Examples: Name, Social Security Number, Drivers License Number, Date of Birth, etc.) With the passage of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, commercial banks, investment banks, securities firms, and insurance companies were allowed to consolidate.

name: GLOBE
def: GLOBE - Geographic Locator Of Business Exposures - Interactive and batch GIS service which returns (among other things) territory assignments.

name: GLP
def: GLP - Average Gross Loss Paid - The total amount of money that was paid on claims where the policy failed Enterprise Validation Technology (EVT).

name: GLP
def: GLP - Guideline Level Premium - The level annual premiums required to mature a life insurance policy under guaranteed mortality and expense charges, and an interest rate of 5%. Must be calculated in accordance with the provisions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.

name: GLWB
def: GLWB - Guaranteed Lifetime Withdrawal Benefit - A rider on a variable annuity that allows minimum withdrawals from the invested amount without having to annuitize the investment. The amount that can be withdrawn is based on a percentage of the total amount invested in the annuity.

name: GOLF
def: GOLF - Global Office Locator Facility - A Geographic Information Systems (GIS) type of software tool for generating a list of On Your Side Auto Repair Network (formerly Blue Ribbon Repair Shop - BRRS) locations near a customer.

name: GOR
def: GOR - Good Order Requirement - Document and/or information necessary to complete a specific type of business process, procedure, or transaction.

name: GRC
def: GRC - Governance, Risk management and Compliance

name: GRC
def: GRC (Governance, Risk management & Compliance) is an umbrella term for the enterprise approach to management of risks, compliance activities and the overall management approach towards governance of the enterprise. Nationwide is currently analyzing a consolidated GRC approach for the enterprise.

name: GRC
def: GRC - Guaranteed Replacement Cost - "Guaranteed Replacement Cost" in the property & casualty world. Guaranteed Replacement Cost represents what it would cost to replace a lost or destroyed item without deducting for depreciation or inflation.

name: GSD
def: GSD - Good Student Discount - The policy premium discount offered to students who meet certain academic standards. For example, full-time students with a B or better grade average who are under 25 years of age.

name: GSQD
def: GSQD - Goal State Quality Database - Tool used to track quality assurance data.

name: GTO
def: GTO - Guaranteed Term Option - Investment option that provides a guaranteed interest rate paid over a certain length of time. Three, five, seven, and ten year GTOs are offered to Nationwide customers.

name: GUI
def: GUI - Graphical User Interface

name: HA
def: HA - High Availability - An attribute of a system that guarantees the functionality of critical business services during defined periods of activity. To fully achieve this goal each component of the system -- infrastructure, middleware, application, and data -- must be built in a manner that is resilient to failure.

name: HEIL
def: HEIL - Home Equity Installment Loan

name: HELOC
def: HELOC - Home Equity Line Of Credit - A type of mortgage. The real estate property used as collateral is the borrower's home. If the borrower defaults on payments, the lender reserves the right to collect on the collateral -- in this case, the borrower's home.

name: HGIC
def: HGIC - Harleysville Group Insurance Company

name: HIPAA
def: HIPAA - Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (of 1996) - Nationwide Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) Privacy Policies and Procedures are located here: http://privacy.nwie.net

name: HMO
def: HMO - Health Maintenance Organization

name: HO
def: HO - Homeowners Policy

name: HR
def: HR - Human Resources - Nationwide Human Resources works with associates and managers in multiple ways, including promoting associate engagement, attracting and retaining talent, managing performance and rewards, championing change, and contributing to associate health, wellness, and safety.

name: HRA
def: HRA - Health Reimbursement Account - Nationwide offers several types of reimbursement/spending accounts. These accounts help you fund your out-of-pocket health care or dependent day care expenses on a tax favored basis. By using these accounts, you can reduce your taxable income. These accounts are administered by WageWorks.

name: HRBP
def: HRBP - Human Resource Business Partners - An HR Business Partner is an assigned associate who acts as a liaison to a business unit and its associates.

name: HRIS
def: HRIS - Human Resources Information System - A software or online solution for the data entry, data tracking, and data information needs of the Human Resources function within a business.

name: HRP
def: HRP - Human Resource Profile - Your HR profile containing name, address, phone, etc...

name: HSA
def: HSA - Health Savings Account - Nationwide benefits offering that is a savings or investment account that allows eligible individuals who participate in a high deductible health plan to pay for current and future qualified medical expenses on a tax-free basis. The HSA is available to associates who are enrolled in the Health Savings Choice health care options. Nationwide matches a certain percentage of associate-contributed funds, as well as contributing money directly to accounts of associates in the My Health program.

name: I&O
def: I&O - Infrastructure and Operations - The I&O office delivers high-quality solutions by being effective stewards of Nationwide's infrastructure and providing value, availability and on-time delivery for our business.

name: IA
def: IA - Internal Audit - The Office of Internal Audit (IA) is an independent, objective assurance and advisory service team within Nationwide, focused on adding value to Nationwide's operations. It works alongside other key governance and compliance functions as a component of Nationwide's risk management structure.

name: IA
def: IA - Independent Agent - A producer who is an independent contractor, not an employee of Nationwide, who may have a selling agreement with one or more insurance companies. Sells and services the insurance company's products that most appropriately meet the needs of their clients.

name: IAA
def: IAA - Insurance Application Architecture

name: IAA
def: IAA - Independent Agency Acquisitions - Self service website to enhance understanding of the IAA program and benefits.

name: IABC
def: IABC - International Association of Business Communicators - A knowledge network of professionals engaged in strategic business communication management.

name: IADB
def: IADB - Insured Account Database - Global IADB (Insured Account Database) is a CLT account reference, clearance, and reservation system consisting of a database and service wrapper layer.

name: IADT
def: IADT - Individual Annuities Desk Top - Graphical user interface for PALLM.

name: IAM
def: IAM - Identity Access Management - Application used on Nationwide.com for direct customer authentication. Used by both Property and Casualty personal customer and Nationwide Financial personal customers.

name: IAQ
def: IAQ - Internet Abandoned Quote - A quote that is started on the Internet but has not completed.

name: IAR
def: IAR - Investment Adviser Representative - An individual who provides advice about securities to clients for a fee. Works for a Registered Investment Adviser Firm.

name: IAS
def: IAS - Integrated Application Services

name: IBHS
def: IBHS - Insurance Institute for Business and Home Safety - Funded by insurers and reinsurers, the IBHS mission is to reduce the social and economic effects of natural disasters and other property losses by conducting research and advocating improved construction, maintenance and preparation practices.

name: IBNR
def: IBNR - Incurred But Not Reported - An actuarially determined amount representing claims that have occurred, and the insurer is liable for, but is unaware of because the claim has not yet been presented to the insurer or does not have a sufficient case reserve. Pure IBNR reserves are an actuarially determined amount representing claims that have occurred, and the insurer is liable for, but is unaware of because the claim has not yet been presented to the insurer.

name: IC
def: IC - Independent Channel - Network of insurance agents who work with multiple insurance companies.

name: ICA
def: ICA - Independent Agency, Commercial and Agribusiness - A Nationwide business division

name: ICAP
def: ICAP - Instant Capacity - Standard physical server configurations kept in stock for quick deployment.

name: ICM
def: ICM - Incentive Compensation Management

name: ICP
def: ICP - Internet Change Processing

name: ICP
def: ICP - Information Classification and Protection - A framework for classifying information assets so that employees can take appropriate steps to securely store and share it on the job.

name: ICP
def: ICP - Interactive Commercial Processing - An interface into commercial policy processing.

name: ID
def: ID - Independent Dealer - A type of broker dealer which is an independent firm solely involved in broker dealer services.

name: IDC
def: IDC - Infrastructure Delivery Consultant

name: IDL
def: IDL - Infrastructure Delivery Leader - The Infrastructure Delivery Leader (IDL) leads IT infrastructure solution development for an assigned business solution area (BSA). They are the primary point-of-contact for BSAs.

name: IDLY
def: IDLY - Infrastructure Delivery

name: IDP
def: IDP - Integrated Delivery Planning - Department name under IT Applications and Data Services organization.

name: IDR
def: IDR - Identity Recovery - Combines identity theft insurance with services that help identity fraud victims restore their credit history and identity records to pre-theft status. Coverage and service are provided for key owners, employees and resident family members of key owners and employees. However, while Identity Recovery coverage is attached to a commercial lines policy, we are not insuring the business identity itself, but rather key individuals of the business.

name: IDT
def: IDT - Identity Theft - This coverage is sold usually as add to a homeowners and/or automobile insurance

name: IER
def: IER - Internal/External Reporting - Accounting and regulatory reporting.

name: IGO
def: IGO - In Good Order - A request for a business process, procedure, or transaction is submitted with complete and accurate documents and/or information required to complete the request.

name: IIA
def: IIA - Insurance Institute of America - Educational organization working to enhance the knowledge and understanding of insurance.

name: IIBA
def: IIBA - International Institute of Business Analysis - Independent non-profit professional association for the growing field of business analysis. Our goal is to create greater awareness of the BA profession by defining what is business analysis and working toward recognition of the value of the business analyst role. IIBA can help your business do business better, to gain a competitive advantage in the marketplace and enable your organization to succeed.

name: IIG
def: IIG - Individual Investment Group

name: IIHS
def: IIHS - Insurance Institute for Highway Safety - Nonprofit research and communications organization funded by auto insurers (the crash test dummy people. For decades IIHS has been a leader in finding out what works and doesn't work to prevent motor vehicle crashes in the first place and reduce injuries in the crashes that still occur.

name: III
def: III - Insurance Intermediaries Incorporated - This wholly-owned brokerage subsidiary of Nationwide Insurance is also known as Triple I. It is one of two components of Nationwide Brokerage Solutions.

name: IIQ
def: IIQ - IdentityIQ - Nationwide tool to manage user access to systems and data

name: IIU
def: IIU - Internal Investigations Unit

name: IL
def: IL - Incurred Losses - Losses or claims the insurance company is liable for or has paid. A calculation representing the sum of the Finance definitions of Net Paid Losses and Change in Loss Reserves.

name: IM
def: IM - Inland Marine Insurance - This broad type of coverage was developed for shipments that do not involve ocean transport. Covers articles in transit by all forms of land and air transportation as well as bridges, tunnels and other means of transportation and communication.

name: IMB
def: IMB - Intelligent Mail Barcode - A Postal barcode used to sort and provide tracking visibility on letter and flat mail.

name: IMG
def: IMG - Nationwide Investment Management Group - The investment arm of Nationwide Financial Services, Inc. (NFS). IMG comprises Nationwide Funds Group (NFG) and Nationwide Investment Advisors, LLC (NIA). Based in King of Prussia, PA.

name: IMO
def: IMO - Independent Marketing Organization - An association of general agents that have joined together to form a larger, more powerful group for the purpose of more effectively advocating their interests with insurance and financial services product carriers.

name: IMS
def: IMS - Information Management System - IBM Information Management System (IMS) is a joint hierarchical database and information management system with extensive transaction processing capabilities.

name: INIF
def: INIF - Issued Not In Force - It's a Life Underwriting term used for policies that are approved medically and issued (the policy has been generated, printed, and mailed to the producer), but it is not In-Force because of some outstanding requirements (ie. premium, amendment, signature, etc. . . ).

name: INS
def: INS - Insured - The party or parties who are protected by an insurance policy, or the state/act of being guaranteed compensation against loss or harm relative to specified party/parties or property.

name: IPCS
def: IPCS - Interactive Problem Control System - An IBM tool to aid in diagnosing software failures.

name: IPI
def: IPI - Individual Performance Incentive - A short-term incentive with defined start and end dates, typically covering a one-year time frame that's used to provide an incentive for achieving pre-established objectives critical to resolving major business challenges.

name: IPM
def: IPM - Iteration Planning Meeting - It is a terminology used in Agile for a planning meeting that happens for every iteration.

name: IPS
def: IPS - Individual Products & Solutions - IPS provides income protection through life and annuities product development and servicing, all with the goal of delivering on the noble purpose of being there for our members in their times of greatest need.

name: IQB
def: IQB - Internet Quote and Bind

name: IRA
def: IRA - Individual Retirement Account - A type of Traditional Individual Retirement Arrangement (Traditional IRA) which is a trust or custodial account set up in the United States for the exclusive benefit of an individual or his/her beneficiaries. Individual Retirement Accounts are described in section 408(a) of the Internal Revenue Code (IRC).

name: IRA
def: IRA - Individual Retirement Arrangement - A tax-favored personal savings arrangement, which allows an individual to set aside money for retirement. An IRA may provide tax advantages, depending on individual circumstances. There are several different types of IRAs, including traditional IRAs, Roth IRAs, and Savings Incentive Match Plan for Employees (SIMPLE) IRAs.

name: IRC
def: IRC - Internal Revenue Code - Federal tax law, enacted by Congress in Title 26 of the United States Code (26 U.S.C.). The IRC is complex and its sections must be read in context of the entire Code and the court decisions that interpret it. The Internal Revenue Service (IRS) administers the IRC.

name: IRE
def: IRE - Intelligent Rules Element - Consists of an object representation of policy, client, vehicle and coverage.

name: IRI
def: IRI - Insured Retirement Institute

name: IRM
def: IRM - Information Risk Management

name: IRPM
def: IRPM - Individual Risk Premium Modification - Rating factors that allow underwriting to modify pricing to better meet the risk's characteristics.

name: IRT
def: IRT - Inter-Regional Transfer - Transfer of insurance policies and records including claims from one Regional Office to another because the policyholder moved.

name: ISC
def: ISC - Investor Service Center - Website where Nationwide Financial customers manage their investments. It is also used by Plan Sponsors (business owners) to manage their online account.

name: ISO
def: ISO - International Organization for Standardization - Independent, non-governmental organization that is the world's largest developer of voluntary international standards. Published standards cover a wide variety of topics, including but not limited to information security, quality management, and risk management.

name: ISO
def: ISO - Insurance Services Office - An organization that supports exchange of information between insurance companies and sets standards for policy forms.

name: ISP
def: ISP - Infant Summary Proceeding

name: ISU
def: ISU - Immediate Settlement Unit - The Immediate Settlement Unit (ISU) consists of Property Claims Associates who handle small homeowner losses during the initial claim report. ISU Associates receive claim information from call center CSRs via warm transfers and then attempt to settle the claim. If ISU cannot settle a claim within 24 hours, the claim is assigned to a field Claims Associate.

name: ITAC
def: ITAC - IT Architect Certification

name: ITDM
def: ITDM - Information Technology Delivery Model - The IT Delivery Model defines how we deliver solutions to our business partners and users. It outlines how we are organized, what services each of the organizations provide, the critical processes we share and standardize, and how we govern shared decisions across IT. It also identifies the IT Professions and the roles associates play in making IT work.

name: ITGC
def: ITGC - Information Technology General Controls - There are a handful set of controls tested and reviewed by Internal Audit in consultation with FRC(Financial Reporting Controls)PMO.

name: ITIL
def: ITIL - Information Technology Infrastructure Library - A set of practices for IT service management (ITSM) that focuses on aligning IT services with the needs of business.

name: ITIN
def: ITIN - Individual Taxpayer Identification Number - An identification number issued to those who are non-U.S. residents and not eligible for a SSN but have federal tax reporting or filing requirements.

name: ITSD
def: ITSD - IT ServiceDesk - The IT ServiceDesk is an inbound/outbound call center, which is the single point of contact for initiating any desktop and/or technology service incidents requiring diagnosis and resolution.

name: ITSM
def: ITSM - Information Technology Service Management - Information Technology Service Management (ITSM) is Nationwide's IT initiative to meet customer needs by utilizing core service management processes based on the best practices of the Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) framework developed in the United Kingdom by the Office of Government Commerce (OGC).

name: ITSME
def: ITSME - Information Technology Solutions Management & Engineering

name: ITV
def: ITV - Insurance to Value - The concept that a home should have enough coverage to rebuild it to its current condition in the event of a total loss. This is often more than the assessed property value or the real estate market value. You are "insured to value" if you've purchased enough insurance to cover the total cost of rebuilding your home and replacing all your belongings.

name: ITWE
def: ITWE - IT Workforce Effectiveness - A leadership team with the stated mission of empowering all IT associates to lead successful careers and to enable people leaders to effectively manage and inspire our workforce to deliver for our businesses.

name: IUL
def: IUL - Indexed Universal Life Insurance - Life insurance policy that offers a death benefit with cash value accumulation potential and protection against market-based losses.

name: IUO
def: IUO - Internal Use Only - An ICP Framework classification for information that is generally available internally but not to the public.

name: IUT
def: IUT - Integrated Unit Test

name: IVANS
def: IVANS - Insurance Value Added Network Services - Nationwide and Allied are members of IVANS.

name: IVR
def: IVR - Interactive Voice Response - Interactive voice response (IVR) is a technology that allows a computer to interact with humans through the use of voice and DTMF tones input via a keypad. In telecommunications, IVR allows customers to interact with a companys host system via a telephone keypad or by speech recognition, after which services can be inquired about through the IVR dialogue. IVR systems can respond with pre-recorded or dynamically generated audio to further direct users on how to proceed. IVR systems deployed in the network are sized to handle large call volumes and also used for outbound calling, as IVR systems are more intelligent than many predictive dialer systems - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interactive_voice_response

name: IW
def: IW - Internal Wholesaler - See Regional Internal Consultant (RIC).

name: JAWS
def: JAWS - Job Access With Speech - A popular screen reader for the visually impaired.

name: JUA
def: JUA - Joint Underwriter Association - The combination of several insurance companies to provide the capacity to underwrite a particular type or size of exposure.

name: KB
def: KB - Knowledge Base

name: KISS
def: KISS - Keep it Simple - KISS is Nationwide's bi-weekly live web show, co-hosted by Eric Whitnable and Elizabeth Leab. The show focuses on collaboration and new technologies both at Nationwide and throughout the industry. Tune in to kiss.nwie.net every payday Friday for interviews with fellow Nationwiders, interactive training, polls, prizes, and illuminating conversation.

name: KLO
def: KLO - Keep the Lights On - Efforts that require maintenance/support activities that are required by the business, but may not be adding new capabilities or benefits.

name: KPI
def: KPI - Key Performance Indicator - A statistic that is generally used in management objectives.

name: LAC
def: LAC - Legal Administrative Clerk

name: LAE
def: LAE - Loss Adjustment Expense Incurred - A calculation representing the sum of Defense & Cost Containment Incurred and A&O Incurred.

name: LAN
def: LAN - Local Area Network

name: LAYL
def: LAYL - Land As Your Legacy - Part of the Grow Financial effort, is the Land As Your Legacy program. The mission of Land As Your Legacy is to provide security to families engaged in the agricultural community so that the land and businesses that they have worked for generations will be preserved and remain a legacy for generations to come. Land As Your Legacy is also designed to expand financial services to our agribusiness members who may only have property and casualty products with us.

name: LBA
def: LBA - Legal Bill Audit/Advisor - Allows preferred defense council and trail division council to enter invoices into a Web app.

name: LBCH
def: LBCH - Lock Box Clearing House

name: LC
def: LC - Latino Connection - Des Moines based Associate Resource Group. Latino Connection's mission is to promote cultural competency within Nationwide and to assist in the professional growth of our members. We will work on behalf of Nationwide to impact our diverse market base through community involvement. We create an inclusive environment by welcoming and encouraging participation from all associates who align with our mission.

name: LCD
def: LCD - Life Customer Database - Client database for Individual Protection's fixed line of products

name: LCM
def: LCM - Loss Cost Multiplier - Expense rating factor applied to base premium for the class of business being rated.

name: LCOM
def: LCOM - Life Commission - This NF system provides commission services for Nationwide Financial Network (NFN/ EA NSI) producers selling NF proprietary Life products.

name: LCS
def: LCS - Life Commission System - The NF system which provides commission services for NF Non-Affiliated Producers and NWI Independent Affiliated Producers (such as Allied and Harleysville) selling Life business.

name: LDI
def: LDI - Loss Description Indicator - Functionality in CLASS that enables the categorization of loss causes.

name: LDP
def: LDP - Leadership Development Program

name: LDRPS
def: LDRPS - Living Disaster Recovery Planning System - A system used to create and maintain business continuity plans.

name: LEAP
def: LEAP - Legal and Expense Analysis Processing - Reporting files that ACRS uses to run reports for legal purposes. Now only consists of a file that is used for reporting. The LEAP file is created each calendar month-end and contains input from LPS and correspondence.

name: LESOP
def: LESOP - Leveraged Employee Stock Ownership Retirement Plan - A defined contribution retirement plan in which a company leverages its credit to borrow money to fund the retirement plan. The company uses the borrowed funds to purchase shares from the companys treasury for the retirement plan and makes annual contributions to repay the original loan.

name: LIFO
def: LIFO - Last In First Out - System in which the last record or task entered is executed first.

name: LIFTS
def: LIFTS - Life Information Financial Transaction System

name: LIFTS
def: LIFTS serves as a policy valuation and data entry system. Calculates tax information and feeds the 1099R tax processing for the Vantage Product Systems. Cyberlife and Vantage applications use LIFTS daily for Tax reporting purposes.

name: LKQ
def: LKQ - Like Kind and Quality Parts - Type of aftermarket part represented as being of similar functionality and durability as Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) parts.

name: LLC
def: LLC - Limited Liability Company - A hybrid type of legal business structure that provides the limited liability features of a corporation and the tax efficiencies and operational flexibility of a partnership.

name: LLP
def: LLP - Limited Liability Partnership - A type of partnership that varies by state which extends certain limited personal liability to all partners from a copartner's individual actions. It can otherwise act as general or limited partnership.

name: LMA
def: LMA - Lead Management Action - The resultant opportunity when using analytical insights to increase opportunities for acquisition.

name: LOA
def: LOA - Leave Of Absence - General Information Managers can use this page to add a new Leave of Absence (LOA) for a direct report, or to update the return date on an existing LOA. Before processing an unpaid Leave of Absence for an associate, consult with your HR representative regarding Leave of Absence policy and approval. An associate must have at least one year of service to qualify for a Leave of Absence. A Leave of Absence must be at least 11 days but not greater than 5 months.

name: LOB
def: LOB - Line of Business - High-level breakdown of insurance and financial services product categories.

name: LOC
def: LOC - Line of Credit

name: LOU
def: LOU - Loss of Use Coverage - A coverage that reimburses the insured for costs incurred due to moving out of the residence premises(Homeowners) or vehicle rental (Auto) due to damages from a covered loss.

name: LPDP
def: LPDP - Large Policy Discount Premium - Discount rating factor that allows pricing to be modified to meet risk characteristics.

name: LPI
def: LPI - Loss Potential Index - Used in QNB reporting; calculated using underwriting criteria and claims history.

name: LPS
def: LPS - Legal Processing System - System for the recording of legal suits and related information. It interfaces with CPS to synchronize reserve and payment information. It is used by field claims people and by general counsel for contingent liability suits. See also LEAP.

name: LR
def: LR - Loss Ratio - A comparison of incurred losses and earned premiums obtained by dividing Incurred Losses by Earned Premium. Loss ratio can be either on a direct basis (most common in internal management reporting), or on a net basis for calculation of TCR.

name: LRO
def: LRO - Lincoln Regional Operations

name: LRS
def: LRS - Loss Reserving System - Sets the reserves by transmitting reserves, ultimates or ratios for various summary levels.

name: LTC
def: LTC - Long-Term Care - Assistance for basic daily activities such as eating, bathing or dressing that an individual may need due to an accident, long-term illness or the natural aging process. Long-term care can be provided in the individual's own home, nursing home or other facility.

name: LTI
def: LTI - Long Term Incentive Plan - Provides Senior Executive participants a financial stake in the future success of Nationwide's business by rewarding them for sustained results and value creation.

name: LTU
def: LTU - Light Touch Underwriting - A team of Associate Underwriters handling protocol driven new business and limited renewal types for BOP, BA, and Umbrella ($2M limit or under) accounts with premium less than $20,000.

name: MA
def: MA - Management Action - The resultant opportunity when using analytical insights to create the right opportunity, at the right time, for the right party, via the right channel.

name: MAAA
def: MAAA - Member of the American Academy of Actuaries - A credentialed member of the American Academy of Actuaries.

name: MAAC
def: MAAC - Mid-Atlantic Agent Advisory Council

name: MAO
def: MAO - Management Action Opportunity - See Management Action (MA).

name: MARG
def: MARG - Military Associate Resource Group - This group is under the Office of Diversity and Inclusion and assists Nationwide leadership with all things military related and provides a voice for military connected associates. We also represent Nationwide at many public functions.

name: MARI
def: MARI - Measuring Actuarial Rate Impact

name: MAW
def: MAW - Methodology Adoption Workshop

name: MB
def: MB - Marconi Building - 275 Marconi Blvd, Columbus, Ohio

name: MBS
def: MBS - Mortgage-backed security

name: MCAS
def: MCAS - NAIC Market Conduct Annual Statement - An NAIC mandatory annual filing for insurance companies which meet specific reporting criteria. Collects data on a state-specific, industry-wide basis. Provides regulators with information not otherwise available for their market analysis initiatives.

name: MCAT
def: MCAT - Major Catastrophe - Widespread damage caused by a certain event (e.g., hurricane).

name: MCC
def: MCC - Marketing, Communications & Collaboration - Marketing Communications & Collaboration (MCC) Business Solution Area (BSA) within Enterprise Applications

name: MCCA
def: MCCA - Michigan Catastrophic Claims Association - The Michigan Catastrophic Claims Association (MCCA), a private non-profit unincorporated association, was created by the state Legislature in 1978. Michigan's unique auto insurance no-fault law provides unlimited lifetime coverage for medical expenses which result from auto accidents. The MCCA reimburses auto no-fault insurance companies for each Personal Injury Protection (PIP) medical claim paid in excess of a set amount. Currently that amount is $500,000. A fee is applied to auto policies.

name: MCD
def: MCD - Multi-Car Discount - A premium reduction factor applied when two or more four-wheel private passenger autos owned by an individual or owned jointly by two or more individuals resident in the same household.

name: MCR
def: MCR - Member Care Representative

name: MD
def: MD - Material Damage - Damage to any type of real property. Principally refers to autos at Nationwide.

name: MDM
def: MDM - Master Data Management - A technology-enabled discipline in which business and IT work together to ensure the uniformity, accuracy, stewardship, semantic consistency and accountability of the enterprise's official shared master data assets.

name: ME
def: ME - Medical Expense - A name used in some states for Medical Payments coverage for vehicle insurance (which provides medical, surgical, ambulance, etc.) for the insured and passengers when they are injured accidentally while riding in the insured's vehicle.

name: MEC
def: MEC - Modified Endowment Contract - Life insurance policy in which the aggregate premiums have exceeded the cumulative funding limits causing the policy to be subject to special tax rules.

name: MEP
def: MEP - Multiple Employer Retirement Plan - A retirement plan maintained by two or more employers for the purpose of pooling plan assets to reduce administrative costs and for advantageous investing. Fiduciary responsibilities lie with the plan sponsor of the MEP, not with the employer(s).

name: MF
def: MF - Mutual Fund - A type of investment company that pools money from many investors and invests the money in stocks, bonds, money-market instruments, other securities, or even cash. Also referred to as a "Fund".

name: MFA
def: MFA - Multi-Factor Authentication - The use of two or more forms of identification to authenticate a user during login or other transaction.

name: MGA
def: MGA - Managing General Agent - A specialized type of insurance agent/broker that, unlike traditional agents/brokers, is vested with underwriting authority from an insurer. Accordingly, MGAs can perform certain functions/roles ordinarily handled only by insurers.

name: MH
def: MH - Mobile Homeowners - Policy covering mobile homes and contents.

name: MIM
def: MIM - Microsoft Identity Manager - MIM, or Microsoft Identity Manager, is a self-service group management tool. Anyone in Nationwide can use this tool to create and manage Distribution Groups (DGs), also known as Distribution Lists (DLs).

name: MIPLT
def: MIPLT - Marketing & Intellectual Property Legal Team - Provides enterprise-wide legal support for issues involving marketing, advertising, intellectual property, social media, public relations, and sponsorships.

name: MJE
def: MJE - Manual Journal Entry - A journal entry posted through non-automated processes.

name: MKT
def: MKT - Marketing Systems - A general term referring to all marketing systems including sales results.

name: MLD
def: MLD - Multi-Line Discount - A premium reduction factor applied when two or more qualifying insurance or financial products within the Nationwide Enterprise are owned by residents in the same household.

name: MLPS
def: MLPS - Mortgage Loan Processing System - Investment application supporting investments in mortgages.

name: MLRP
def: MLRP - Marketing Leadership Rotation Program

name: MMDA
def: MMDA - Money Market Deposit Account - Can be thought of as a hybrid account, offering features similar to both a checking and savings account. Officially known as a Money Market Deposit Account; sometimes referred to as a Money Market Account or Money Market.

name: MMX
def: MMX - Mitchell International - Claims estimating vendor.

name: MOFB
def: MOFB - Mid-Ohio Foodbank - Foodbank that distributes food to over 600 food pantries, soup kitchens, shelters, after-school programs, and senior housing sites across central and eastern Ohio.

name: MOI
def: MOI - Memorandum of Insurance

name: MP
def: MP - Medical Payments Coverage - A coverage written with Vehicle/General Liability/Homeowners insurance which provides benefits for medical expenses under a covered event.

name: MPS
def: MPS - Managed Print Solutions - "To make printing a faster, simpler, and more powerful tool for you..."

name: MRA
def: MRA - Market Research and Analytics

name: MRC
def: MRC - Monthly Recurring Costs - Monthly Recurring Costs (MRC) is a term referenced in Request For Service (RFS) documents.

name: MRDF
def: MRDF - Mail Run Data File

name: MRV
def: MRV - Market Reference Value - Compensation range ordinarily paid in the marketplace for a similar job. MRV provides a reference point used to determine its competitive value. Local market conditions may also affect the MRV.

name: MSA
def: MSA - Motorcycle, Snowmobile, and ATV - Nationwide's unique cross channel - multi product program that allows the customer to have all of their seasonal on/off road personal land conveyances in one policy. Serviced through the Powersports platform / Service Center.

name: MSB
def: MSB - Marshall Swift/Boeckh - Marshall and Swift/Boeckh (MS/B) Provider of building cost valuation information and estimating technologies for the underwriting and claims operations of the property and casualty insurance industry and is Nationwide Insurance and Allied Insurance vendor of choice for our main-street (under $750,000) reconstruction cost estimates.

name: MSH
def: MSH - Make Safe Happen - Nationwide's Cause Marketing program dedicated to reducing accidental injuries to children.

name: MSI
def: MSI - Microstrategy, Inc.

name: MVA
def: MVA - Market-Value Adjustment - An adjustment made from a redemption or transfer out of a fixed account fund, pursuant to the terms of the contract, that reflects an increase or decrease in market value.

name: MVR
def: MVR - Motor Vehicle Report - Report of accidents and traffic violations for any licensed driver as recorded in the State Department of Motor Vehicles.

name: MWCZ

name: POL

name: POS
def: POS - Point of Sale - The source of the sale (e.g., agencies). Place where a retail transaction is completed. It is the point at which a customer makes a payment to a merchant in exchange for goods or services.

name: PPA
def: PPA - Pension Plan Administrator

name: PPA
def: PPA - Private Passenger Auto - Generic description for cars in the Auto Line of Business. Usually refers to an auto that is not classed as antique or classic.

name: PPD
def: PPD - Project Planning Document

name: PPGA
def: PPGA - Personal Producing General Agent - A life insurance industry term used to describe an individual agent who has entered into a selling agreement directly with an insurance company authorizing such individual agent to solicit insurance sales on behalf of the insurance company.

name: PPL
def: PPL - People & Practice Leader

name: PPM
def: PPM - Program Portfolio Management

name: PPOI
def: PPOI - Proof of Prior Insurance

name: PPS
def: PPS - Personal Property Solutions - Application area supporting homeowners and personal property systems.

name: PR
def: PR - Public Relations

name: PRI
def: PRI - Payment Relationship Identifier - An AIMS Firm Payment Relationships attribute used to identify all entities (producers and firms) in a selling hierarchy for the BGA and IMO distribution channels.

name: PRI
def: PRI - Premium Reporting Interface - PRI replaced the portion of ASRS Premiums collection of data from NAPS and CLIPS.

name: PRV
def: PRV - Premium Refund Validation - Application for handling of premium refunds.

name: PSC
def: PSC - Participant Solutions Center - Nationwide Retirement Solutions Participant Solutions Center; employees are licensed with Nationwide Securities, LLC, to sell variable financial products.

name: PT
def: PT - Performance testing

name: PUL
def: PUL - Personal Umbrella Liability - Umbrella insurance is designed to give someone added liability protection above and beyond the limits on homeowners, auto, and watercraft personal insurance policies.

name: PURR
def: PURR - Pricing Universal Realignment & Re-rating - Realignment and re-rating application using claims and policy data from the data warehouse.

name: PYD
def: PYD - Potential Youthful Driver - Identifies youth who will be eligible to drive the parent's (policyholder's) vehicle.

name: QA
def: QA - Quality Assurance - The Quality program is intended to help operational leaders monitor and measure how well associates perform tasks the way they're trained.

name: QC
def: QC - Quality Center - Manual and Automated Quality Assurance test management tool by Hewlitt Packard (HP).

name: QMF
def: QMF - Query Management Facility - A DB2 support product. Within an MVS environment, QMF runs under the control of TSO and ISPF. It allows you to create queries to select, add, change or delete data stored in the DB2 data base tables.

name: QoS
def: QoS - Quality of Service

name: QRG
def: QRG - Quick Reference Guide - Reference material that provides rapid lookup of information for an application, site, tool, etc.

name: QSA
def: QSA - Qualified Security Assessor

name: QTP
def: QTP - QuickTest Professional - Functional test automation tool from HP.

name: R&T
def: R&T - Requirements & Testing Services

name: RAAC
def: RAAC - Regional Agency Advisory Council

name: RAC
def: RAC - Real Allocation Cluster - Refers to multiple interconnected computers or servers that appear as if they are one server to end users and applications. Oracle RAC enables you to cluster Oracle databases. Oracle RAC uses Oracle Clusterware for the infrastructure to bind multiple servers so they operate as a single system. It enables you to create a clustered pool of storage to be used by any combination of single-instance and Oracle RAC databases.

name: RACF
def: RACF - Resource Access Control Facility - IBM software product used in authentication and authorization (login, user profile).

name: RACI
def: RACI - Responsible-Accountable-Consulted-Informed - Matrix describing participation by various roles in completing tasks or deliverables for a project or business process; typically created with vertical axis of tasks or deliverables and horizontal axis of roles. Source: Wikipedia

name: RADS
def: RADS - Regulatory Advisory Distribution Systems - New regulatory and legislative material is distributed through RADS.

name: RAFT
def: RAFT - Reusable Automation Framework for Testing - Custom tool developed by Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) for application testing. This tool is used within the Personal Lines Transformation test team.

name: RAMS
def: RAMS - Reserving Allocation Mainframe System - Batch flow for building of IBNR (Incurred But Not Reported) reserves. Related to forecast of P&C claims expenses.

name: RAPP
def: RAPP - Report Analysis and Planning Package - MI package to develop plan for operating results and metrics.

name: RAROC
def: RAROC - Risk-adjusted return on Capital - A financial measure that takes into account 2 main factors when allocating capital: The return potential of the investment as well as the risk involved.

name: RAS
def: RAS - Reserve Analysis System - P&C graphical user interface for entry of LOAs (Level of Analysis) related to reserving processes. Feeds Reserve Analysis Mainframe System (RAMS) which feeds IBNR (Incurred But Not Reported Reserve). All of these relate to a forecast of claims not yet reported.

name: RBC
def: RBC - Risk-based Capital - Also, Royal Bank of Canada (RBC Bank in the U.S.)

name: RBP
def: RBP - Registration By Proxy - Registration By Proxy occurs when an agent or Customer Service Representative (CSR) helps a customer create an online profile.

name: RC
def: RC - Replacement Cost - The cost to replace the damaged property with materials of like kind and quality, without any deduction for depreciation. This valuation method is a claims settlement option for physical damage/loss coverage provided in an insurance policy.

name: RC
def: RC - Request Central

name: RCA
def: RCA - Root-cause Analysis - A step-by-step methodology to discover a fault's first or prime reason for being. Every failure happens for one or more reasons, cause by a definite progression of actions and consequences that lead to a failure. Any group that performs such analyses. An RCA investigation traces the cause and effect trail from the end failure back to the root cause, similar to crime solving.

name: RCE
def: RCE - Reconstruction Cost Estimate

name: RDP
def: RDP - Remote Desktop Protocol by Microsoft

name: RDP
def: RDP - Rapid Deployment Pack - An HP product used to install servers in an automated fashion.

name: REFT
def: REFT - Recurring Electronic Funds Transfer

name: REI
