name: REIT
def: REIT - Real Estate Investment Trust - A security that invests in real estate and is sold like a stock.

name: RES
def: RES - Risk Evaluation System - Research tool for insurance staff with very detailed underwriting and classification data.

name: RES
def: RES - Reserving - A general term for reserving of funds to pay for future claims.

name: RFC
def: RFC - Request for Change

name: RFC
def: RFC - Request For Coverage - This term was established in coordination with Project Spotlight and is just a more technical term for a Life Insurance Application. RFC is used in conjunction with Underwriting Desktop.

name: RFP
def: RFP - Request for Proposal - A request sent to vendors to propose a solution for a stated need.

name: RFQ
def: RFQ - Request for Quote - Pricing-oriented request for proposal (RFP).

name: RFS
def: RFS - Request for Service - RHEL - RedHat Linux

name: RIA
def: RIA - Registered Investment Adviser Firm - A firm that provides advice about securities to clients for a fee. An Investment Adviser Representative works for a Registered Investment Adviser firm.

name: RIC
def: RIC - Regional Internal Consultant - An NF wholesaler, also referred to as an internal wholesaler, works in the NF office supporting the RVP(s) in their relationships with firms and producers. A RIC is usually assigned to support one or two RVPs.

name: RIM
def: RIM - Records and Information Management - RIM directs, communicates and enforces compliance with Nationwide's records management policy and schedule.

name: RITE
def: RITE - Rapid Iterative Testing and Evaluation - Commonly referred to as RITE testing, this usability testing method measures participant behavior and feedback, which the facilitator uses to continually make prototype modifications throughout the testing process.

name: RLT
def: RLT - Run Governance Leadership Team

name: RMD
def: RMD - Required Minimum Distribution Withdrawal - In general, minimum amounts that a retirement plan participant must withdraw annually starting with the year that he/she reaches 70 1/2 years of age or, if later, the year in which he/she retires.

name: ROI
def: ROI - Return on Investment

name: ROM
def: ROM - Rough Order of Magnitude - Project management term. Alternative for "ball park estimate."

name: ROSRS
def: ROSRS - Regional Office Statistical Reporting System - P & C Financial reporting application for Claims, PRV, ARP, DWP, etc......

name: RP
def: RP - Retirement Plans - The Retirement Plans segment of business includes Public Sector and Private Sector pension plans.

name: RPA
def: RPA - Robotic Process Automation - RPA is a viable solution to automate repetitive manual tasks such as data entry, processing and simple system-to-system communication.

name: RPO
def: RPO - Recovery Point Objective - Disaster recovery planning term : Specifies the point in time up to which you must be able to restore data, such as all data saved by the end of the previous day.

name: RPS
def: RPS - Repetitive Payment System - RPS 6, RPS 16 and RPS 19 are systems used for our Income Products business. RPS is a benefit administration system, with advanced capabilities to handle a variety of annuity and bank products as they mature into the payout phase.

name: RPT
def: RPT - Retirement Planning Tool

name: RRC
def: RRC - Rational Requirements Composer

name: RRS
def: RRS - Regulatory Reporting Systems - Regulatory reports customized to meet requirements of each state.

name: RSA
def: RSA - Roadside Assistance - Coverage option/service available for purchase with a vehicle policy that provides customers with emergency services in case of a flat tire, lockout, dead battery, fuel, towing or other similar services.

name: RSLT
def: RSLT - Run Services Leadership Team

name: RTB
def: RTB - Reason to Believe - Reason to Believe is a marketing term that is a key element of the brand positioning statement. It provides proof points or support.

name: RTC
def: RTC - Rational Team Concert

name: RTO
def: RTO - Recovery Time Objective - Disaster recovery planning term : The period of time within which an application must be recovered after an outage. Recovery Time Objective Legend : C1 Recover in < 8 Hrs C2	Recover in < 24 Hrs C3	Recover in < 48 Hrs C4	Recover in < 72 Hrs E5	Recover in < 7 Days E6	Recover in < 14 Days I7	Recover in < 30 Days I8	Recover in > 30 Days

name: RTW
def: RTW - Regional Territory Wholesaler - An NF wholesaler, assigned to a geographic area other than the more densely populated Metropolitan Statistical Areas (MSAs) which are assigned to RVPs and RICs.

name: RVP
def: RVP - Regional Vice President - An NF wholesaler, also referred to as an external wholesaler, works in the field in his/her respective sales territory calling on firms and producers.

name: S2M
def: S2M - Speed to Market

name: SA
def: SA - Service Advantage - A mainframe platform for auto and property quotes.

name: SA
def: SA - Standard Auto

name: SA
def: SA - Separate Account - See the Nationwide Business Glossary (http://businessglossary.nwie.net) for definition.

name: SaaS
def: SaaS - Software as a Service

name: SAID
def: SAID SSO - Standard Automated Internal Desktop Single Sign On

name: SAP
def: SAP - Single Accountable Person - Person with ultimate responsibility for project or initiative.

name: SASU
def: SASU - Spanish Assistance Support Unit

name: SBA
def: SBA - Skills Based Assignment - A claims application to assign adjusters based on their skill set.

name: SBT
def: SBT - Standard Based Template - The template Guidewire creates for each line based on ISO's Electronic Rating Content. SBT provides an 'out of the box' User Interface, Coverages, Forms Inferences, and Rating Content.

name: SCC
def: SCC - Security Command Center - Comprehensive security center dedicated to cyber security, including vulnerability management and incident response.

name: SCCM
def: SCCM - Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager - SCCM is the corporate application for Office Technology inventory reporting and software distribution. Formerly known as Microsoft Systems Management Server (SMS)

name: SCORM
def: SCORM - Sharable Content Object Reference Model - A collection of standards and specifications for web-based e-learning

name: SCR
def: SCR - Schedule Change Request - Schedule Change Request

name: SCS
def: SCS - Specialty Care Services - A Standard Commercial vertical designed to serve the Senior Living and Human Services industries.

name: SDIP
def: SDIP - Safe Driver Insurance Plan - Under this system, rates are based more on driving record and less on demographics. Violations and accidents are assigned codes that result in point assessments which in turn cause a surcharge on liability rates.

name: SDLC
def: SDLC - Systems (or Software) Development Life Cycle - SDLC is "the process of creating or altering systems (or software), and the models and methodologies that people use to develop" them.

name: SDM
def: SDM - Sales Data Mart

name: SDP
def: SDP - InfoSphere MDM Suspect Duplicate Processing - In Infosphere MDM, there are two forms of SDP; a batch or off-line process known as evergreen, and real-time or on-line process known simply as SDP. Both forms of SDP involve matching using a common set of customizable matching rules.

name: SDS
def: SDS - Software Development Services

name: SEC
def: SEC - U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission - A federal agency whose mission is to protect investors, maintain fair, orderly, and efficient markets, and facilitate capital formation. The primary overseer and regulator of the U.S. securities markets.

name: SEC
def: SEC - Servicing Existing Customers - Florida-specific underwriting agency binding term.

name: SEO
def: SEO - Search Engine Optimization - Taking steps in web design and maintenance to improve Web search results.

name: SEQ
def: SEQ - Security Engagement Questionaire - IT project complete a submit the SEQ to IT Risk Management (typically during Initiate or Solution Scoping) to allow the security consultant to assess the risk and determine their involvement in the project.

name: SEUSS
def: SEUSS - System for Enterprise User Security Standards - Standards for identity and access management services for external business partners. Came about because of usability issues (e.g., multiple signon credentials), long development times, inconsistent security policy enforcement (e.g., regulatory issues) and operational inefficiencies (e.g., multiple application solutions). Web service provided by Corporate Internet that contains authentication rules that are defined by corporate security.

name: SFLE
def: SFLE - Standard Form Log Entry - Addendum to a claim recorded by the claims associate for the purpose of clarity and to document the processing of the claim.

name: SHRP
def: SHRP - Safe Home Rating Plan - Identifies chargeable claims and assigns points to the claims during the experience period. Typically three years preceding policy effective date. The assignment of these points may result in surcharges which may affect the premium.

name: SI
def: SI - Source Integrator - The file monitoring system for the Finance Integration Layer (FIL) application. It notifies SLAM of receipt of a FIL interface file. SI automates the enforcement of interface integrity checks and/or thresholds that can halt files that fail.

name: SIC
def: SIC - Scottsdale Insurance Company - Scottsdale Insurance Company, a company within the Scottsdale Group (SG), is a wholly owned subsidiary of Nationwide. SIC specializes in the processing of Excess and Surplus Lines (high risk) insurance. The main office is located in Scottsdale, Arizona.

name: SIG
def: SIG - Standardized Information Gathering - The Standardized Information Gathering questionnaire is part of the vendor assessment process, performed by Information Risk Management (IRM) professionals, to ensure appropriate controls are in place to protect Nationwide's information assets. This questionnaire was previously called the TPQ or Third Party Questionnaire.

name: SIP
def: SIP - Service Improvement Plan (SIP) - Service Improvement Plan (SIP) information can be found in the SPOT site for Service Level Management.

name: SIRF
def: SIRF - Suspicious Incident Reporting Form - Form for an associate to use in reporting suspicious activity in a confidential manner. Form is not currently listed in A-Z listing on Inside but can be found by doing a SPOT search.

name: SIU
def: SIU - Special Investigations Unit - Investigates potential fraud in claims.

name: SLA
def: SLA - Service Level Agreement

name: SLAM
def: SLAM - Service Level Agreement Monitoring & Alert System - The database that houses the established SLA and alert settings for each FIL interface. SLAM automatically monitors the receipt of FIL interfaces against established SLAs and sends alerts when an SLA is missed or when an unexpected additional file is received for a FIL interface.

name: SLES
def: SLES - Suse Linux Enterprise Server - (SLES) 11 on z/VM on the Mainframe.

name: SLM
def: SLM - Service Level Management - Service Level Management (SLM) is the process responsible for negotiating service level agreements (SLAs) with the business and ensuring they are met. It is the process that ensures that the required and cost-justifiable service quality is maintained and gradually improved by planning, coordinating, drafting, agreeing, monitoring and reporting of SLAs. It also ensures there is an ongoing review of the service achievements.

name: SMA
def: SMA - Separately Managed Account - See the Nationwide Business Glossary (http://businessglossary.nwie.net) for definition.

name: SME
def: SME - Subject Matter Expert - That individual who exhibits the highest level of expertise in performing a specialized job, task, or skill within the organization.

name: SMP
def: SMP - Special Multi-Peril - A package policy providing basic property and liability insurance coverages, plus some options (i.e., crime, glass, and auto non-ownership coverages).

name: SMS
def: SMS - Strategic Marketing System - Reports on info from ABI (competition), Equifax (demographics), GDT (GIS) and other sources.

name: SMS
def: SMS - Supply Management Services - Area of the company that acquires goods and services for Nationwide and affiliates from third-party suppliers.

name: SMS
def: SMS - Short Message Service (cellular phone text messaging) - Using SMS, a short alphanumeric message (approx. 160 alphanumeric characters) can be sent to a mobile phone to be displayed there, much like in an alphanumeric pager system.

name: SMS
def: SMS - System Management Server - A Microsoft Windows-based software distribution tool designed to help an organization manage, support, and maintain a distributed network of computer resources. Designed for medium- and large-sized organizations that manage large numbers of clients in a complex and rapidly changing business environment.

name: SMS
def: SMS - Safety Measurement System - A major tool to measure the safety of individual motor carriers and Commercial Motor Vehicle (CMV) drivers. Helps identify and monitor safety problems as part of the CSA 2010 safety improvement process.

name: SMTP
def: SMTP - Simple Mail Transfer Protocol - Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) is an Internet standard for electronic mail (e-mail) transmission across Internet Protocol (IP) networks. SMTP was first defined by RFC 821 (STD 10) (1982),[1] and last updated by RFC 5321 (2008)[2] which includes the extended SMTP (ESMTP) additions, and is the protocol in widespread use today. SMTP is specified for outgoing mail transport and uses TCP port 25. The protocol for new submissions is effectively the same as SMTP, but it uses port 587 instead.

name: SNAPS
def: SNAPS - Scottsdale Network Access Provisioning System - A web-based form used to request access for internal associates and contractors to resources, including applications, shared drive directories, remote access, etc. It is accessed from the Scottsdale Associate Directory. This tool is most often used to request access for new users or when an existing user needs increased rights or is transferred to another department. The form is typically submitted by a supervisor or above, or their assigned SNAPS delegate.

name: SOA
def: SOA - Service Oriented Architect - Under the office of Corporate Apps, the Business Solution Area (BSA) CIM/SOA Shared Services, BSA Leader is currently Scott Sanders.

name: SOCS
def: SOCS - Span of Control System

name: SOD
def: SOD - Statement Of Direction - The direction that the the Nationwide Enterprise department or service is going. The statement listing the progression, advancement, changes, moves, upgrades, etc...

name: SOL
def: SOL - Statute of Limitation - Legal time period of presenting a claim

name: SOP
def: SOP - Standard Operating Procedure - An SOP is a written document or instruction detailing all steps and activities of a process or procedure. ISO 22000 essentially requires the documentation of all procedures used in any manufacturing process that could affect the quality of the product.

name: SOP
def: SOP - Service of Process - Service of Process is the procedure used to give formal notice to a person or entity that a court or other body is exercising authority over them. Typically, a very specific method is defined by each jurisdiction to actually execute the Service of Process itself. Nationwide has a dedicated unit that handles or distributes nearly all inbound Service of Process requests received corporately. The Nationwide Service of Process team can be reached by calling 1-877-764-0418.

name: SOW
def: SOW - Statement of Work

name: SOX
def: SOX - Sarbanes Oxley Act (of 2002) - Also known as Corporate and Auditing Accountability and Responsibility Act. Sarbanes-Oxley contains 11 titles that describe specific mandates and requirements for financial reporting. While this does not apply to privately held organizations, Nationwide Financial was originally SOX compliance before all outstanding shares were purchased by Nationwide Mutual Insurance Company (Nationwide) in early 2009.

name: SP
def: SP - Strategic Partnerships

name: SPD
def: SPD - Summary Plan Description - A document that tells participants what a benefits plan provides and how it operates: when an employee can begin to participate in the plan, how service and benefits are calculated, when benefits become vested, when and in what form benefits are paid, and how to file a claim for benefits. The Department of Labor (DOL) requires that participants be given information about the plan in a summary plan description and the Summary Plan Document (SPD) must be on file with the DOL.

name: SPHR
def: SPHR - Senior Professional Human Resources - Professional certification renewable every three years through continuing education credits or by exam.

name: SPIA
def: SPIA - Single Premium Immediate Annuity

name: SPOF
def: SPOF - Single Point Of Failure - A term mostly used in Information Technology

name: SPOT
def: SPOT - SPOT is Nationwide's version of SharePoint. Not every feature of SharePoint is available in SPOT. You can think of SharePoint as an online computer program used for document storage and office productivity. It was made by Microsoft in an attempt to connect offices digitally and simplify employee collaboration.

name: SQA
def: SQA - Software Quality Assurance - Software Quality Assurance

name: SRD
def: SRD - Solution Requirements Deliverable

name: SRM
def: SRM - Shared Rules Management - Business Use: Underwriting Rules Management Utility Description: Rules Management application used to manage, generate, and deploy rules to the Shared Rules Services application. Interface: Web Application

name: SRM
def: SRM - Supplier Relationship Management - Team within Supply Management Services (SMS) responsible for post-contract collaboration and partnership with Nationwide's strategic and preferred suppliers.

name: SRM
def: SRM - Site Recovery Manager

name: SRO
def: SRO - Southeastern Regional Operations - Office located in Raleigh, North Carolina. Serves - Alabama, Arkansas, Florida, Georgia, Mississippi, North Carolina and South Carolina.

name: SRS
def: SRS - Shared Rules Services - Business Use: Underwriting Rules Engine; Critical application used to execute Underwriting decisions during the quoting, binding, amending, and renewal of policies.

name: SRS
def: SRS - Suit Reporting System - Tracks attorneys associated with a claim as either a party or a provider; works with CLASS.

name: SSC
def: SSC - Sales & Services Center

name: SSN
def: SSN - Social Security Number - A unique nine-digit number assigned by the U.S. Social Security Administration (SSA) to identify an individual when reporting wages, paying taxes and collecting benefits.

name: ST
def: ST - System Test - May refer to system testing, the system testing environment or both.

name: STD
def: STD - Short-Term Disability

name: STOA
def: STOA - Stranger-originated annuity - Sometimes seen as stranger-owned annuity.

name: STOLI
def: STOLI - Stranger-originated life insurance

name: SURGE
def: SURGE - Single Universal Rate Generation Engine - A Powerbuilder application for generating the COBOL modules used in the rating process.

name: SVLO
def: SVLO - Single Vehicle Liability Only

name: SVOC
def: SVOC - Single View of Customer - An aggregated, holistic representation of the data known by Nationwide Enterprise about its potential, current, and former customers.

name: SWOT
def: SWOT - Strength, Weakness, Opportunity, Threat - An analysis of interaction between particular business characteristics and the competitive marketplace.

name: SWRO
def: SWRO - Southwestern Regional Operations - Office located in Scottsdale, Arizona. Serves - Arizona, Colorado, Montana, New Mexico, Oklahoma, Texas, Utah and Wyoming.

name: TA
def: TA - Transfer Agent - Stand between security issuing companies and security holders. Record changes of the ownership of securities, maintain the issuer's security holder records, cancel and issue certificates, and distribute dividends.

name: TAC
def: TAC - Tested and Approved Changes - One of the FRC controls that essentially evaluates operational effectiveness of Change management process. See FRC acronym for more details.

name: TAL
def: TAL - Technology Area Leader

name: TAL
def: TAL - Technology Area Leaders

name: TCO
def: TCO - Total Cost of Ownership - TCO includes development, maintenance and costs of support for an application.

name: TCR
def: TCR - Trade Combined Ratio - Percentage of each premium dollar spent on claims (losses and loss adjusting expenses) and underwriting / operating expenses (note, over 100 is considered a underwriting loss).

name: TCS
def: TCS - The Claims System - Claim reporting system for Allied.

name: TD
def: TD - Trial Division - Trial division of Nationwide Mutual Insurance Company.

name: TDD
def: TDD - Test-driven Development

name: TDD
def: TDD - Telephone Device for the Deaf

name: TDM
def: TDM - Test Data Management - TDM is a Shared Services organization of IT experts focused on the provisioning of masked and synthetically generated data for both Mainframe, Distributed and Cloud platforms to meet the needs of our Test, Development, and QA Teams throughout Nationwide IT with appropriate governance and industry best practices.

name: TDOE
def: TDOE - Talent Diversity Organization Effectiveness - Department name for the group that focuses on talent development, diversity and inclusion, and organization effectiveness.

name: TDS
def: TDS - Trial Division System - A general term for the set of applications in support of the Trial division.

name: TEFRA
def: TEFRA - Tax Equity and Fiscal Responsibility Act of 1982 - An Act of Congress, passed in 1982, to provide for tax equity and fiscal responsibility, and for other purposes. Also known as Public Law 97-248.

name: TEM
def: TEM - Test Environment Management - Test Environment Management (TEM) is a Shared Services organization of Mainframe, Distributed, DevOps and Cloud experts focused on managing end-to-end Test Environments. TEM manages the test environments at various test region levels to meet the needs of the application, Tier 1 projects and interfacing applications needs. They also provide TEM services for both Mainframe and Distributed platforms throughout Nationwide IT with the appropriate governance and industry best standards.

name: TES
def: TES - Travel Expense System - An internal application for reimbursement of business travel expenses.

name: TFS
def: TFS - Team Foundation Server - Team Foundation Server

name: THI
def: THI - Titan Holdings, Inc.

name: TIN
def: TIN - Tax Identification Number - A TIN is also known as a Taxpayer Identification Number and may be a Social Security Number (SSN), an Individual Taxpayer Identification Number (ITIN) or an Employer Identification Number (EIN). An SSN is used by an individual U.S. citizen, an ITIN is used by an alien and an EIN is used by an employer or company.

name: TIV
def: TIV - Total Insured Value - The maximum possible financial loss as reflected by the total of all applicable policy coverage limits less the total of all applicable policy deductibles.

name: TL
def: TL - Total Loss - Total Loss vehicle. Refers to a vehicle that has been involved in a loss and is deemed non-repairable or a total loss.

name: TL
def: TL - Towing and Labor - A type of coverage available for automobile insurance policies that provides reimbursement of expenses related to the towing and labor performed at the site of a disabled vehicle enabling it to be moved/driven to a repair location (e.g., jump start).

name: TLM
def: TLM - Technology Lifecycle Methodology

name: TLV
def: TLV - Total Limits Value - A high estimate of possible financial loss as reflected by the total of all applicable policy coverage limits.

name: TML
def: TML - TML Information Services - URO vendor for reporting of MVR or credit rating.

name: TOI
def: TOI - Type of Insurance - A categorization of different insurance products. Within Nationwide typically applied to Commercial Lines insurance products.

name: TOL
def: TOL - Time of Loss - The time of a loss to property

name: TOPS
def: TOPS - Time-off Planning System - This time off management system was replaced by My Time found in HR Web App.

name: TPA
def: TPA - Third Party Administrator - An independent business entity, hired by the plan sponsor of a retirement plan to perform administrative tasks associated with the operation of the plan, e.g., record keeping and reporting.

name: TPC
def: TPC - Third Party Carrier

name: TQA
def: TQA - Technical Quality Assurance - A Technical Quality Assurance Review Report is created during the middle of a project to measure the architecture and design quality of an IT solution.

name: TSB
def: TSB - Technology Standards Board - A governance body that provides leadership across the enterprise to ensure the selection of technology products adheres to the architecture standards and supports the technology direction. All software must be approved by the TSB.

name: TTNI
def: TTNI - Titled to Named Insured

name: TU
def: TU - TransUnion - URO vendor for reporting of MVR or credit rating.

name: TUBA
def: TUBA - Total Unaideded Brand Awareness - The sum of consumers within a sample population that are currently aware of a specific brand or product without being prompted with possible names, divided by the total sample population.

name: UAC
def: UAC - Underwriting, Audits and Compliance - The Underwriting, Audits, and Compliance Team is responsible for promoting operational and strategic excellence for many of the core functions of Nationwide and Allied's Personal Lines operations.

name: UAM
def: UAM - User Access Management - One of the FRC controls that essentially evaluates operational effectiveness of User access governing process including user access administration while maintaining segregation of duties(SoD). See acronym FRC for more details.

name: UAS
def: UAS - Underwriting Advisory System - This system uses CLOUT files and sends CLOUT to Commercial Underwriting System.

name: UAT
def: UAT - User Acceptance Testing - UAT is the development phase of enhancements and new features to websites prior to implementation/production.

name: UC
def: UC - Upper Concourse - The floor beneath the 1st Floor in Plaza One (home office).

name: UCD
def: UCD - User Centered Design

name: UCD
def: UCD - Urban Code Deployment - A tool for automating application deployments through environments. It is designed to facilitate rapid feedback and continuous delivery in agile development while providing the audit trails, versioning and approvals needed in production.

name: UCR
def: UCR - Usual, Customary and Reasonable - The amount paid for a medical service in a geographic area based on what providers in the area usually charge for the same or similar medical service. The UCR amount sometimes is used to determine the allowed amount.

name: UD
def: UD - Underwriting Desktop - Underwriting Desktop is a point of entry for all new life insurance applications. It automatically generates a policy number for new applications and it manages the underwriting and case requirements from external vendors for the applications.

name: UI
def: UI - User Interface

name: UIM
def: UIM - Underinsured Motorist - An insurance coverage which helps pay insured's bodily injury and/or property damage expenses that result from an accident caused by a driver that does not have sufficient coverage to pay for all expenses.

name: UL
def: UL - Universal Life Insurance - A type of permanent life insurance that offers flexible premiums and flexible coverages. Within certain restrictions, it allows the contract owner to change the premium amount, the payment mode, and adjust coverage amounts.

name: ULTRA
def: ULTRA - Underwriting Leverage Through Rule based Accountability - Regional independent and exclusive channel subject matter experts meet weekly to examine automated business rules, (GSUW rules) changes to rules, and to provide feedback on process topics related to company bypass.

name: UM
def: UM - Uninsured Motorist - An insurance coverage which pays insured's bodily injury and/or property damage expenses that result from an accident caused by an uninsured motorist or in some states, an unidentified hit and run motorist.

name: UMB
def: UMB - Commercial Umbrella Policy - A form of insurance that provides excess limits to other liability coverages such as Business Auto, Businessowners, or General Liability, when the other liability coverage limits have been reached due to payment of claims.

name: UPB
def: UPB - Unpaid Principal Balance - The amount of principal owed on a mortgage loan.

name: UPR
def: UPR - Uninsured Premium Reserve - The liability established to reflect the amount of premium for the portion of the insurance coverage that has not yet expired.

name: URBO
def: URBO - Ultimate Repository Based Online - The workflow and content management system that provides a snapshot of all Nationwide sales and advertising materials.

name: URL
def: URL - Uniform Resource Locator - Often used interchangeably with a website address (e.g., http://www.nationwide.com/).

name: URO
def: URO - Underwriting Report Ordering - An enterprise application for access to multiple vendors providing MVR (motor vehicle report) and credit reporting.

name: URS
def: URS - Universal Reinsurance System - URS is a reinsurance administration system for ceded, assumed or retroceded reinsurance administration, regardless of volume. For years many carriers have relied on massive spreadsheets, physical documents and in-house experts to administer reinsurance.

name: UT
def: UT - Unit Testing - IT testing phase generally completed by development staff on system changes.

name: UWRS
def: UWRS - Underwriting Reports Services - UnderWriting Reports Services (UWRS) is hosted on the Nationwide mainframe in North Data Center. UWRS provides Credit (CBR or PCR), MVR, CLUE Auto (ALH), Auto Current Carrier (ACC), Enterprise Validation Tool (EVT), and CLUE Property (PLH). [UWRS Adapter is hosted on the Allied mainframe in North Data Center.]

name: VA
def: VA - Virtual Asset - An instance of a piece of software or a service. Examples of virtual assets include a server operating system (OS), copy of licensed software, or an email system.

name: VA
def: VA - Virtual Agent - A customer service management tool consisting of a chatterbot program that serves as an online customer service representative for an organization. Because virtual agents have a human appearance and respond appropriately to customer questions, they lend automated interactions a semblance of personal service.

name: VALU
def: VALU - Unit Value System - Application designed to calculate unit values. Primary source of fund level data, fund house and fund information, and unit values.

name: VAN
def: VAN - Value Added Network - The method of transport for electronic information when EDI is used as the communication vehicle. An EDI service provider offering a communication link between companies to enable the exchange of electronic documents.

name: VAR
def: VAR - Value At Risk - A statistical technique used to measure the financial risk associated with an investment portfolio.

name: VBF
def: VBF - Vital Business Function - ITIL term for critical business needs.

name: VCC
def: VCC - Virtual Call Center - A virtual call center (VCC) is a managed service provider (MSP) model for call centers, where calling software, backend communication servers and other management modules are virtually delivered over the Internet. A VCC eliminates the need to build, operate and manage in-house call center equipment.

name: VDE
def: VDE - Virtual Desktop - External - Replaces VPN for non-Nationwide associates. See VDI for Nationwide associates,

name: VDI
def: VDI - Virtual Desktop - Internal - Replaces VPN access for Nationwide associates.

name: VIA
def: VIA - Validation/Improvement/Acceptance - A set of activities and deliverables for a system that: measure and validate the quality of data; identify potential opportunities to improve the quality of the data; and determine if the quality of the data is considered acceptable for identified consumers.

name: VIDS
def: VIDS - Investment Data System

name: VIF
def: VIF - Vehicles in Force - Number of vehicles in force at a given point in time.

name: VIN
def: VIN - Vehicle Identification Number - An identifier assigned to a vehicle by the manufacturer that uniquely distinguishes the vehicle. Currently comprises up to 17-digit sequence of letters and numbers

name: VIR
def: VIR - Vital Information Reporting (Community Agency) - Viability program to track success on the community agency force.

name: VL
def: VL - Variable Life Insurance - A type of permanent life insurance with investment options (fixed-income investments, stocks, mutual funds, bonds, money market funds, etc.). Premiums are fixed, but the death benefit and cash value may vary, reflecting the performance of the investments.

name: VMM
def: VMM - Vandalism and Malicious Mischief - Willful damage to or destruction of property by a person or persons other than the insured. Covered as an endorsement or a named peril. Also used as an exclusion.

name: VMS
def: VMS - Visual Management System

name: VPI
def: VPI - Veterinary Pet Insurance

name: VPN
def: VPN - Virtual Private Network - "A virtual private network (VPN) is a network that uses primarily public telecommunication infrastructure, such as the Internet, to provide remote offices or traveling users access to a central organizational network." -Wikipedia

name: VUL
def: VUL - Variable Universal Life Insurance - A type of permanent life insurance that combines the flexible premiums and flexible coverages of universal life insurance, with the investment features of variable life insurance.

name: WAD
def: WAD - Working as designed. - A software product working as expected by the developer, but not in the manner expected by the user. An application in conformance to a wrong or inappropriate specification; useful, but misdesigned.

name: WAS
def: WAS - Websphere Application Server - WebSphere Application Server, an IBM product, offers the high levels of reliability, availability, security and scalability for applications.

name: WC
def: WC - Workers Compensation - State mandated insurance providing medical treatment, wage replacement and disability compensation to employees who suffer job-related injuries or illnesses, and death benefits to dependents of workers who have died as a result of their employment.

name: WCA
def: WCA - World Class Admins - World Class Admins, is the Associate Resource Group within the Office of Diversity & Inclusion, which encompasses any Administrative Professional at Nationwide.

name: WCM
def: WCM - Web Content Management - A Web Content Management system allows updating a web application content in near realtime. This decreases time to market, and allows fresh infromation to be disseminated quickly

name: WD
def: WD - Wrongful Death

name: WFH
def: WFH - Working From Home

name: WFM
def: WFM - Work Force Management

name: WH
def: WH - Wirehouses

name: WH
def: WH - Warehouse

name: WHI
def: WHI - Web Hosting Industry

name: WHIC
def: WHIC - Western Heritage Insurance Company - Western Heritage Insurance Company, a company within the Scottsdale Group (SG), is a wholly owned subsidiary of Nationwide. WHIC specializes in the processing of Excess and Surplus Lines (high risk) insurance, specifically General Liability, Property and Garage. The main office is located in Scottsdale, Arizona.

name: WIN
def: WIN - Intranet for Word Processing

name: WIN
def: WIN - Word Processing Information Network - WIN is the primary and go-forward tool for use with PolicyCenter, that is utilized by our Screening, Underwriting, Processing and Servicing teams to create letters to be mailed to our members, agents and third parties. WIN is menu driven, intuitive and web based and due to its connection to our current and future policy systems (NAPS, FPS and PolicyCenter), it is able to interact with policy information as well as post letter activity on the policy history screens.

name: WINS
def: WINS - Wheatley Insurance Systems - WINS integrates policy management (policy control, agent policy number assignment, policy issuance, rating, note pad), claim management (including generation of claims checks, diary, notepad), and reinsurance (processing of facultative and/or treaty reinsurance) into one system, meeting the information and regulatory needs of property and casualty insurers for SIC, WHIC and FS.

name: WIP
def: WIP - Work in Progress

name: WR
def: WR - Work Request

name: WRO
def: WRO - Western Regional Operations - Office located in Sacramento, California. Serves - California, Idaho, Nevada, Oregon and Washington.

name: WRTS
def: WRTS - Work Request Transmittal System

name: WS4U
def: WS4U - We Stand For You - Nationwide Agribusiness marketing slogan.

name: WSG
def: WSG - Web Services Gateway

name: WYSIWYG
def: WYSIWYG - What You See Is What You Get - A viewing format for a word or picture processing application that allows the viewer to accurately observe on the processing or development GUI screen what the finished product will look like.

name: XDATE
def: XDATE - Expiration Date - Date on which all coverages provided in the policy cease.

name: XML
def: XML - Extensible Markup Language - A W3C published simple, flexible text format derived from SGML. A structured, hierarchical, tag based coding language used as the format to transfer Web data. A general-purpose markup language to facilitate sharing data across different systems, particularly those connected through the Internet and point-to-point. The basic format method for all messages defined by XML specifications, and to declare structure and content of an XML document.

name: XREF
def: XREF - Agency Cross Reference - A system of reference which brings together distribution partner (agency / firm and producer) data from multiple systems across the enterprise and identifies relationships between agency / firm and producer codes from the various source systems.

name: XSD
def: XSD - XML Schema Definition - The XML Schema language. XSD ensures that the information in a XML document is in a correct and consistent format, and that all the necessary information has been included.

name: YD
def: YD - Youthful Driver - At Nationwide, this refers to any driver under 25 years of age.

name: YOY
def: YOY - Year Over Year

name: YT
def: YT - Your Time

name: YTD
def: YTD - Year to Date

name: ZBE
def: ZBE - Zero Balance Error - A situation in which a series of financial transactions result in a net zero dollar amount. This is considered incorrect.
